title: Lyrics Verification
author: speleojazzer
body: Attaching the wrong lyrics to a song occasionally occurs and is at best annoying and at worse may expose younger or more sensitive customers to damaging content.I suggest three improvements are actioned :1 : The (automatic) linking of lyrics from external providers where there is not an exact match of all items of information, should be flagged up internally for operators to double check, and2 : On the assumption that even (1) is not fool-proof, there needs to be a clicker very visible on the lyrics page for customers to flag up to Spotify staff for immediate attention where lyrics are possibly or definitely miss-matched.3 : Its taken me a lot of searching (including guidance from Spotify support) to get to this point. Navigating customer support should be easier.

Â  Weâ€™re closing this idea since it doesnâ€™t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 3: â€œOne change request per Idea.â€ Â  On another note, you can already report if the lyrics are not correct by tapping on the flag on the upper right corner of the lyrics and choosing the right option:Â  Â   Â  If you think your ideas should be considered as separate, feel free to submit them again highlighting how your ideas are distinct from the existing options. title: [Mobile][Playlists] Be able to change the order of songs in a actual playlist
author: Sin2169
body: I think it would be awesome to be able to change the order of songs in the playlists. Sometimes I discover songs that fit perfectly with a combo of 4-5 songs or something but they are far appart in the playlist and I always have to queue them and I technically canâ€™t listen between them without having to open my phone and itâ€™s not pleasing. Changing the order of songs would be a game changer because I would just have to put them together and I donâ€™t have to make sure which song is gonna play next. I like to reorder by removing songs from the playlist and putting them back in my favorite order. Itâ€™s time consuming and sometimes frustrating. title: [Android][Playlists] Make it easy to find my place in a playlist by jumping to active song
author: lbearm
body: I listen to my playlists in order. A few of my playlists are rather larger (over 1,000 songs). When listening to the list, sometimes I want to see where I am at in the playlist (like seeing that I am on song 450 out of 1,000) and then to see what songs are coming next. I know I can see some things in the queue, but I want to look at it from my playlist. This is cumbersome, but not horrible on the Windows interface as it gives me a # for each song on the playlist so I can search up the song and get a feel for where I need to scroll down to. On the Android phone this is just a big pain as I have to scroll until I find the current song and sometimes I miss it and have to start all over again. When I open a playlist that is actively being played, I think it should automatically jump to the active song.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-06Hey @lbearm, Â  Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange. Â  Weâ€™re closing this idea since it doesnâ€™t meet one of our Idea Exchange guidelines, namely point 5: "Make sure your idea is clear." Â  Feel free to submit your idea again, making sure to clarify how it differs from the existing experience. Â  Thanks for understanding.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Auto archive Spotify generated playlists for users
author: Roachforlife
body: Each week, I try to remember to save a copy of my Release Radar, Discover Weekly, New Music Friday, etc to a running playlist since there is no way (that I am aware of) to go back to these. An option to auto add each week before they switch to new content would be great. An even better idea would be an additional option to only add the HEARTED songs to that running tally. As an aside, if there is a way to find the links to old playlists, especially the ones custom curated for me (such as Discover Weekly) somehow I would love to know how to access. Thank you
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04HeyÂ @Roachforlife, Â  Thanks for adding your votes to this idea. Â  We're happy to confirm that this is already possible. You can create a copy of a particular set of songs from your Daily mixes, you just need to select the playlist in yourÂ mobile device app, then, on theÂ three-point menuÂ selectÂ Add to other playlist > New playlist. Â  As a workaround, if you're from theÂ desktop app, you can copy all the songs in a playlist (including the Daily mixes) by selecting it, scrolling until the last song, and clicking at it while pressing shift. All songs will be selected and by clicking the right mouse button, you can add them to the new playlist.

title: [Desktop][Other] What have you done???? What a complete cluster**bleep** of UI!!!!!!!!!

body: Where do I actually complain??? This has GOT to be one of the most user-hostile interfaces I have ever seen. The user interface was 10x better back in 2010. The whole Idea of seeing when new videos come out is cryptic and **bleep**ed on desktop. When a new episode comes out there is no way to see it clearly you have to guess what podcasts might have come out with new episodes with a small small blue dot on new episodes. How has this been easily done on mobile but not on desktop???? Also! Dont make it weird and janky to view your own created playlists. I have to click like 5 more times to just get to my list of playlists that I have had for like 13 **bleep**ing years.

title: [Android][Other] Old Issues that has to be worked on
author: Yazu00
body: I looked through a old post describing an Issue I wanted to draw attention to that 'must' be fixed. That post is from 2017 so it's present for a long time. Straight to the point, The Local Files Player for Spotify can't read the ID3 Tag of mp3 or every other sort of audio file, properly. It doesn't notice changes on the file, it doesn't scan the album covers by the file, i assume it scans it by the album cover. It just doesn't scan the file properly it isn't noticing anything and I have no clue how come the Spotify team never even realised how much of a bad experience the local files player is giving their users, a simple music app player on the playstore can literally detect every change on the file, title, what album it's sorted to and what cover it has. I feel like the local files feature was made but never rly done properly. Make this local files player the way every other simple player works with even extra features like giving the user the ability to change the ID3 Tag informations directly trough the app or making a better ui for the local files too. (Added file shows ss of the spotify player showing the wrong album name)I appreciate reading, and I hope this will get the attention It needs.

title: Shuffle White/Blacklist and Linked Shuffle
author: JediJess
body: This idea is two in one.First is the Shuffle Blacklist/Whitelist.Simply, when you shuffle or randomise your song to include your liked songs or any extra songs outside the current playlist, be able to choose some songs you specifically want to see in the randomisation, or songs based on ones you'd like to see (Whitelist).Alternatively, when you do the same, have a list of songs you do not want to see played (blacklist). The other idea is Linked Shuffle. Add the ability to (directionally) link a song to another, so only specific songs can play after a given song, or so that only a specific song can play before your chosen song. (Eg, choosing to link The Other Side and The Final Trees by Tarrytown or any song that flows immediately from one to another). Maybe a song can have a whitelist of songs they can shuffle to after being played.

Feel free to add your vote to to them below, so that they would have a better chance of being considered, as Spotify always strives to improve your experience. 1[.Playlists] Ability to link together Tracks in Playlists 2.[All Platforms] Shuffle algorithm that favours "unpopular" songsÂ  3.[All Platforms] Option to have a true shuffle Â  Please note that even if an idea is currently set to â€œNot Right Nowâ€ you can still give it a thumbs up to support it as we revisit those ideas on regular intervals. title: [Desktop][Browse] How likely is my playlist to be found by name indicator
author: marcel885
body: When you create a new public playlist its hard to be found because its likely that there are a lot of playlists with the same name. So for some playlist creators its nice to have an index which indicates how likely it is to be found
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hey @marcel885,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange!Weâ€™re closing this idea since it isn't really something that can be realistically implemented at the moment.Â  Search results in Spotify are based on a mix of factors includingÂ popularity and date of creation, so it takes newer playlists a bit longer to show up in searches.Â Usually the more streams and follows one playlists has,Â the bigger changes it has of showing up in search, but that's not all that's taken into consideration. The results alsoÂ varyÂ from user to user based on personal listening preferences. The algorithmÂ could also consider the musical taste of a user when showing the search results. Hope this clears things up. Thanks for understanding.

title: [iOS][Developer] Spotify needs better user-company communication
author: Lazyeye
body: There's ideas, chat, help...but no way to directly voice your concerns with the company. There's a general comment area that can be filled with complaints, but those are easily brushed off and disregardedâ€“many people "shouting" over one another with little reason or thought. I've had genuine issues with the new Home feed, besides the functionality and inconveniences, yet they fall to deaf ears. Social media does not fill the checklist for a proper customer service desk. There needs to be a number and/or email that deals directly with customer concerns. Where do I put genuine complaints and concerns? Feedback? I can't imagine that Spotify tested this new homepage elsewhere complaint-free. It's bugging up my app so much, I can't skip songs as fast as I used to and everything takes forever to load. My phone is already old and slow, I don't need excess visuals to make it worse. And Yet where do I go to tell them that this isn't simply an aesthetic issue, but technical? I resort to an Ideas board, and I will certainly be going in as many places as are accessible in order to be heard.

title: [Desktop][Search] Podcast search within a playlist
author: CourteousCain
body: Currently, the ability to search for episodes within a Podcast is very limited. On the Android Mobile app, you can search for a keyword in a podcast playlist, but it will not show all results in that playlist (it only goes back a period of time, not since the podcast playlist's creation). On the Windows 10 desktop app, there is no feature at all to search within a Podcast. CTRL+F does not work in the app. On the Website, you can use CTRL+F to search, but it only loads a limited number of episodes at a time, so using that search feature is very clunky. In addition, when the webpage gets reloaded, you have to go back down through all the results and load all the episodes you want to search within again.You can search from the basic "Search" function and search for a Podcast name and the title, but you only see very few Episode results, and you can't see all results for that. It's a very clunky and terrible experience trying to search through podcasts. The search feature for songs is implemented great - why is the experience for podcasts so awful? It seems like this idea has been thrown around a lot, but they seem to get closed with a "This was implemented on blah blah blah..." but it's not functional.
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-04Hello @CourteousCainÂ and thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange. Make sure your suggestion does include enough information for us to understand what youâ€™re requesting.  It will be great if you can clarify if you're requesting that all podcast episodes containing a keyword are shown in the search results, regardless of when they were uploaded. Â  More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.

title: [Discover] More Spotify Charts
author: jxckandrew
body: As a lover of music and data, Spotify charts for various countries provide valuable information into the music market of a particular location. It also is of great service to those who live in that country and are able to have music charts reflecting the music taste of their country, along with showcasing local artists. However with the expanded geographical available of spotify in recent years this hasn't been reflected in the addition of charts for various countries that have a large enough userbase to justify daily charts. Some of the countries that I feel desperately need charts are: - Bangladesh- Sri Lanka- Cyprus- Algeria- Lebanon- Tunisia- Jordan- Kuwait- Albania- Croatia- Moldova- Serbia- Slovenia- Bosnia and Herzegovina- Ghana- Kenya- Tanzania- Uganda- Armenia- Azerbaijan- Georgia- Botswana- Jamaica- Cambodia- Laos- Nepal- Uzbekistan- Zimbabwe- Angola- Mozambique- Ethiopia- Libya and more, I have also seen many others advocate for charts in their countries on social media and this very website. Please consider showcasing the charts of more countries as soon as possible

Weâ€™ll be closing this idea as it doesnâ€™t follow one of our Idea Exchange requirements, namely:"One change request per Idea. If you have more than one idea please make a new Idea submission for each."There already are active Live Ideas about some of the listed countries. title: [Mobile][Playlists] Mixtape Style within Playlist
author: _8-gihn43kbu8
body: Are you extremely abnormally specific about your music playlist? Because, unfortunately, I am :(. I've realized that some of my *many* playlists are within the same genre, but I have split them up because of vibes. But sometimes, I don't want that many playlists, but I do want separation. So what if Spotify had a feature like a mixtape that offers you a Side A/ Side B but in one playlist? For instance, let's say you like Classic Rock, like ALOT, but you know each decade has a different sound. You want the ability to listen to them all together but also want to organize them by decade. The playlist would then be " Classic rock" and within it have side or sections so that you could listen to just 60s, 70s, 80s, and so on. Another example is, let's say you're a seasons girlie, and you're in your 2023 ERA. Would it not be cool to have a playlist called 2023 ERA and, within that playlist, have sections for fall, spring, winter, and summer??Let me know what yall think!!

title: [Community][Other] 5 Year Student Discount
author: lady_rainicorn3
body: Spotify currently only offers 4 years of student discount. While I'm sure that this covers a lot of students for the duration of their studies, it does miss out a fair proportion of students. In the UK, there are courses that last 5 years, such as Medicine and Veterinary Medicine, which means for the final year of the course these students can't benefit from student premium despite being a student. I don't think it would be unreasonable to offer a 5th year of premium for these students; it wouldn't apply to everyone and only those who still have access to their university accounts for 5 years so I don't believe Spotify would necessary be at a loss from this. It would benefit those who are still studying and use Spotify but may not be able to pay the full premium cost as they are still paying student fees and are yet to graduate.

title: [Desktop] Social Feed Interaction
author: ashklunk
body: This is an idea that has a wide spread, so it's hard to specify one exact action within the app. I want to preface this by saying that the social aspect of Spotify makes it unique and well-loved by myself and all of my friends and family. The ability to interact with each other through shared playlists, and to be able to see what everybody is listening to live in the app is what we love the most. It turns our personal music library and listening habits into something that we can share, which is exactly what music is about. Sharing and connecting. Spotify is the app for real music lovers. Right off the bat, I know that the idea of any further interaction between users than you already have would start to seem goofy, but you also might want to appreciate how goofy your average playlist-maker, music geek, at-home DJ really is. We really love the fact that that Spotify can connect us with our people musically, especially in a time when people are doubting how genuine social media is...sharing the music we love with others always feels authentic. Currently, you can see a feed of your Facebook friends and what they're listening to in the Spotify app if you have linked the apps together. It is almost like a tease, in as much as you can see these people and what they're listening to yet you can't interact or weigh in at all. It's hard to think of a way to let users interact with each other without opening a huge can of worms, I can see that. I would like to recommend a few ideas that might work. 1) "Friend Recommendations"You could create a default playlist on everybody's account that was called "Friend Recommendations". You could create a function on every individual profile that allowed others to "recommend" music to other users in the same way the app allows us to add songs and albums to our own playlists, or in the way it allows us to see other users playlists and save them. This could keep people using the app longer because they're exploring and diving deep for the sake of sharing with friends and family. Imagine high schoolers and their crushes...this could be the new generation's burnt CD mix. Especially if they could do it in real time. Music is a language we ALL communicate with. 2) "Alerts" for Social InteractionCreating an in-app alert for Spotify is obviously a huge departure from the kind of app you are, I'm sure you don't want to be an intrusive overly-social app. However, in the same way many apps are launching "live sessions", or "group sessions" or "watch parties", you could have an option available for users to choose to be updated immediately when other users send them music in the app or not. You could have it become an option in the "queue" as it were, like, "your friend things you should put this on next". You could keep the queue open for your friends. It would be just like how you can currently choose a private or public listening session. That's all I really have to say! I hope you can appreciate what I as a user would love to have, and I do think many people who use this app would find fun and connection in it. I think your app is already smooth enough to add anything else you want without harming the core function. I mean, you certainly have the talent, budget, and user base to get bigger and better!

title: [iOS] new home layout is an abomination
author: alverde3212
body: the new home layout objectively ruins the user experience. while the small handful of playlists that appear at the top of the screen are somewhat useful, the absence of "jump back in," recently played, genre/artist mixes etc suddenly renders spotify nearly useless. users relied on those features in order to find music with the highest degree of convenience, least degree of friction. now, scrolling through these giant full-screen thumbnails that-- UNBELIEVABLY AND EGREGIOUSLY-- play music that you have not requested be played is just really awful. what's the rhyme or reason here? you guys sell *convenience* to your users, not "interactivity." please please please integrate "view" options for users who would like the more streamlined UI. i don't want all this other junk and i will never use it the way you're hoping i will, which i can only assume is a clunky attempt at additional revenue generation.

title: [Subscription] Graduate and Doctoral Student Discount
author: emmakb
body: Currently, the student discount is set up to be available for 4 years per person. This is a hard and fast rule that does not include gradute or doctoral students. Moving forward, Spotify needs to rewrite their policy to be available for this large population of students! This way they can continue using a platform that they know and love while still getting the student discount that they so desperately need. Higher education is expensive, and being able to save money wherever possible is essential. These students deserve the same student discount as undergraduates. If you're a graduate student, doctoral student, or soon to be either one, hit the like button to make this dream a reality! 100 votes and it'll get passed on for review!

title: [Subscription] Teacher Discount
author: celticmelody1
body: It would be great if Spotify offered a teacher discount for Spotify Premium. Increasingly I am using Spotify in my classroom, but it is frustrating to have to constantly monitor it and jolt across the classroom to mute the ads. I am happy to support the artists I listen to by paying for Spotify Premium, except that with ever more budget constraints, especially to arts programs, it is not feasible to shell out $120/yr from the school's or my own personal budget. I believe that if a teacher discount was offered, we would also be able to promote the use of Spotify with our own students thereby increasing Spotify's users.

title: [Other] Spotify Mini (iPod Nano/Shuffle for Spotify)
author: Penutbuttrr
body: The generations that use Spotify the most right now are the ones that have extreme nostalgia for the iPod nano and all of the portable music devices. I guarantee you that people would have brought them back if it wasn't for two things.1. BluetoothBluetooth was one of the biggest changes to music. Not having the ability to use your airpods or new Bluetooth headphones with an iPod nano is such a detriment. No one wants to go back to using chorded headphones, they want the ease of Bluetooth.2. The change in purchasing music:No one buys music anymore, and that's because of you. Music streaming is how almost everyone listens to music now. Not being able to access your music streaming on an iPod nano is THE reason as to why it has no been brought back like records have. But I present to you the Spotify Mini. With the incredible development of technology within the past decade. Making a device the size of the iPod nano/shufle has so much potential. I propose that you create a device akin to the iPod Shuffle/Nano but with 3 major improvements.1. Increased StorageThe amount of data that we can store in small spaces has skyrocketed since the iPod came out, and the amount that we can store within the small constraints of an iPod Nano is more than enough for all your music needs.2. Bluetooth compatibility.This is an obvious one. Let the device connect via spotify and you're good to go.3. SPOTIFYNow yeah this is obvious, but this device uses Spotify! It will connect to your account through whatever device you choose that you are logged in on, and it has full access to all your playlists and liked songs as long as you have access to wifi. You can download playlists just like you can on your phone, and you can play them whenever, wherever, with such a tiny device. Now finally, why do this at all?Like I said before, the generation that is using Spotify the most are ones that used the iPod nano and shuffle during their childhood. And with this huge nostalgia boost that has been happening recently, recreating this revolutionary device for modern trends and applications would be HUGE. Besides the nostalgia though, the device alone is incredibly useful. For exercising, people will no longer need to take their phone just for music, they can take this small device that can clip to their pants or rest in their pocket with barely any weight and have access to any podcast or playlist they desire without the inconvenience of their oversized phone. I know I got a bit passionate about this, and I'm honestly not sure if anyone will end up reading this. But hopes to one day this reaches someone who can make something really cool. Thank you for reading!
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-30Hey @PenutbuttrrÂ ,Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange. title: [Other] trim/shorten/cut/limit length of songs. automatically play next song after adjustable time
author: bernd_
body: Depending on the situation (e.g. listening to songs in the background) some songs tend to get boring or even annoying after playing too long. Often lyrics and melodies are just repeating over and over and a song that makes joy for the first maybe 2:30 minutes, gets too long while going on until the end after 4, 5 or more minutes. It would be great to have an option to limit the length of songs. After this time, just the next song in the queue shall be played.(in future maybe even with an algorithm choosing automatically a passage within the song to end it).The only similar topic I could find here in the community is:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Music-Custom-Start-amp-Ending-Times-for-a-Track/idi-p/40... But what I'm asking for is much simpler. Not individually for each song, but just a general setting to toggle on/off to cut songs down to e.g. 2 minutes. I know from an arts point of few it's not okay to destroy a song this way. But I think many more different songs could make it into some playlists, where they are not selected at the moment due to their length. For example, when trying to make one playlist for people with diverse tastes to listen to together. I would be super happy and enjoy Spotify even more. Thanks for your feedback on this.

title: [Other] Car thing preset buttons need some refinements
author: imark123440542
body: the way the top preset buttons work is a little unintuitive and easily miss programmed. I would love to see it work in a way much like a car radio, where you either select the album or song or playlist and then press and hold for approximately 3 to 5 seconds to set and then have some sort of Visual confirmation. I have on 3 or 4 occasions had to reprogram them as they have gotten bumped somehow or reset. And then I had to re-figure out how to program back to what they were, which only happens if you go to the playlist you want and play a song within that. Which requires you to stop playing what is currently playing and play something else before it can be reset.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-28HeyÂ @imark123440542, Â  Thanks for bringing your feedback to the Idea Exchange. Â  The goal of Spotifyâ€™s Car Thing exploration was to better understand in-car listening, and bring audio to a wider range of users and vehicles. Based on several factors, including product demand and supply chain issues, we have decided to stop further production of Car Thing units. Existing devices will perform as intended. Weâ€™ve learned a lot from Car Thing, and will continue to focus on the car as an important place for audio. Â  With this in mind, we'll be closing all Car Thing-related ideas, however, we do appreciate your feedback and we've made sure to forward it to the relevant team. Â  Thanks for understanding.

title: Podcast file management
author: user-removed
body: Please allow for greater control and file management for podcasts - if you want to be taken seriously as a podcast platform. See for example Pocketcast's feature set. Some features I think that would greatly improve the experience:create podcast groups/folders. create podcast specific playlists i.e. podcast playlists that appear in the 'Podcasts & Shows' tab of Your Library.ability to archive (and hide played episodescustomisable Your Library tabs. If you listen to more than a dozen or so different shows regularly, podcast episode management quickly becomes a cluttered and messy experience inside of Spotify.I love Spotify, though as someone who listens to a lot of podcasts, I have found the Spotify podcast experience, as it is currently designed, to be a somewhat limited experience.

title: Add to Beginning of Queue vs End of Queue
author: ainsleywilson
body: Instead of just one feature, "add to queue," make two options: "add to beginning of queue" and "add to end of queue." Sometimes you're in the car with a group of friends, and you're trying to curate the exact right songs to play. Then you come across a song that fits perfect and you need to play it immediately but you first have to add it to the queue and then drag it all the way up. Instead, having two features to add to queue would make it a lot simpler to curate the perfect queue without completely messing with it. Oftentimes when I drag up songs, the app glitches and kicks me out anyway, so this solution would bypass that. Just think about it.

title: [Desktop][Other] better embed support for discord and external websites
author: AlexSquibbs
body: in discord, when a user sends a spotify link, an embed for that link will appear in the desktop app in which users can interact with and listen to music with. problem with this is that these embeds treat all users as if they are guests, and that leaves users only getting preview audio rather than the full spotify embed experience. as i have seen with the spotify embeds on my website, users who have not logged into spotify on that browser will get preview audio, while users who have logged into spotify on that browser will get the full audio experience. even if you link your spotify and discord accounts, you will still get treated as a guest user and will get the preview audio, while people who have linked their spotify and discord accounts seem to have the opportunity to be able to play the full audio from the embed. my second part of this is that i suggest the feature to show that embeds are currently playing in the spotify app (desktop/mobile/web/etc), so that users know where the audio source is coming from and can control it. i suggest maybe making the audio source either like the domain name of the website, or whatever is in the websites <title> html tag. for now, spotify just pauses in the player and plays whatever is in the embed without really letting the user know in the app that it is in fact playing from another source (the embed). another part of this that links with the first part, is that the same thing should occur for discord embeds, but this time just mark the audio source as like "Discord". lastly, maybe speak with discord about having their desktop app check if spotify is installed (or running if you want to do that instead), and if so, redirect directly from discord to the spotify app rather than opening a browser page. back on 2/13/2022, i made a discovery that linkages from spotify from the discord desktop app will directly go to the spotify mobile app if the user has the spotify android app installed via windows subsystem, rather than going to a browser page to display. its really cool that this already happens with the spotify android app via windows subsystem for android, but it would be even cooler if this were to happen with the native windows spotify desktop app as well since most people arent gonna have spotify for android installed on their computer sorry that this is a ton to digest, but i just felt like i wanted to share this because i think it would make spotify feel more user friendly and just more "smooth" and "connected" if you know what i mean ðŸ˜‰

title: Limit songs that appear on curated playlists & encourage new artists on curated playlists
author: SlugWheeler
body: I love the concept that Spotify curates playlists for me based on music Iâ€™ve liked or played. Currently, however, Spotifyâ€™s curated playlists are NOT doing what I most want from third party input: I want a fresh, new, different perspective on music so that I can discover new songs and, especially, new artists. Currently, Spotifyâ€™s curated playlists annoy me because they just regurgitate the same songs Iâ€™ve already listened to and, for that very reason, those songs are no longer interesting or enjoyable to me. With that said, I have two suggestions for Spotify:1) Have a way for Spotify users to select the â€œtypeâ€ of curated playlists that they want to receive, with options such as: â€œnew artists only,â€ â€œnew music only,â€ â€œa mix of only new artists and new music,â€ â€œa mix of 75% new artists/music and 25% â€˜lovedâ€™ music,â€ â€œa 50-50 mix of new artists/music and â€˜lovedâ€™ music,â€ or â€œonly a mix of â€˜lovedâ€™ music and artists Iâ€™m following.â€Another feature that Spotify could add that would somewhat address my concern stated above is toâ€¦2) Add a feature that would allow Spotify users to limit how often songs appear on their curated playlists. For example, users could set preferences that would limit songs from appearing on their curated playlists to no more than X number of times during an X week/month/year period. So if I had this ability, again for example, I would set my preferences to limit any song from appearing on my curated playlists to no more than once during a one week period AND no more than 3 times within a 5 week period. This suggestion gets at my being tired of hearing the same music over and over, which would be nice. But this suggestion does not address my desire to learn about new artists and new songs, which I value.

title: Interactive Lyrics

title: [Other] Sleep mode - end of album
author: InstrumentalHopper
body: Sleep mode is my favourite feature in Spotify lately, and have been enjoying using it. Sometimes I turn it on when I'm listening to a playlist and select the audio to stop within the timer I select. However, when I listen to an album, I can only choose to use sleep mode with a timer or when the song has ended. I would like to have the option to use the sleep mode while listening to an album and when the album has ended, the audio stops. This way the listening experience is perfect in my opinion. There doesn't have to be an abrupt ending in the song when the timer has lapsed, it just stops when the album is finished. I can just leave my device on the other side of the room, while I'm in bed enjoying the music. Also, this can be applicable for playlists: when the audio stops, the playlist has ended. Maybe this won't be used as much, but the users have extra freedom using Spotify with it. Of course I am happy to use a bÃ¨ta version of Spotify with this feature and share my feedback. Also, if you are interested in this feature too, let Spotify know. The community is the best place to make our listening experience better.

title: [Android][Developer] Work music is skewing Spotify suggestions
author: mitchk10
body: I listen to Spotify all day while I work: sounds of rain, lofi beats, instrumentals, etc. Essentially - white noise. This results in every single suggestion from Spotify - including the newly released AI DJ - being in this "atmospheric" genre that I don't want to listen to on my free time. The "free time" music is when I want Spotify's suggestions the most: to discover new music I like. Spotify needs to learn how to ignore music trends from M-F 9-5 and focus on what I like to listen to during the weekend. Or - the AI should base its suggestions on the time of day and day of week.
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-27Hi thereÂ @mitchk10, Thanks for the Idea Submission. Â  You can now remove unwanted items from your taste profile, so you don't get recommendations for certain types of music. Check out this article for more info. Â  Cheers.

title: [Android][Developer] Spotify adapted for people with intellectual disabilities
author: juliribotta
body: Hello! I'm Julieta Ribotta, I'm an argentinian student of biomedial engineering.Last week we were with some of my classmates in an institut por people with different capacities and we came across with this problem. This people, are in love of music, it brings them joy, clam and amusement. Currently they have a radio program and different kind of activities. They told us that listening to music is one of the things they enkoy the most, but the problem is that most of the applications for doing this are so developped that sometimes it turns out to be more difficult. After this, we came up with the idea of making an app that would suit more to their needs. We'are going to try to developed this but then i also thougth that maybe you could be interesting in participating, or help us in any kind of way. Just a thought! This simple changes can really change the way this people are included to the society, we don't always think on their needs but it's fundamental to become a more equalitary society.Thank you for your time!Greetings,Julieta. mail:**bleep**
status_message: Updated on 2023-03-27HeyÂ @juliribottaÂ , Â  Thanks for the submission.Â  Â  As much as we'd like to help you out directly in this regard, the forum is not the right place for such a request. title: [Android][Playlists] Remember the queue of a playlist
author: Coalguy1
body: I have 2 playlists. One is my songs that I listen to on a daily basis, like driving to work or doing tasks. The other is my sleeping playlist that I have to fall asleep too. The problem is that I don't go through my whole daily basis playlist in a day, so when it comes time to go to bed I have to get rid of the queue of my playlist. So when I wake up and shuffle the playlist again, I have a high chance of listening to the same songs again from the day before. I would like to be able to shuffle a whole playlist and not have to reshuffle everytime I listen to a different playlist or a podcasts. Adding the option to save a queue would be a good fix to have. A work around I had was to listen to the songs in order without shuffling them and just remembering the song I listened to last, but with the removal of the enhance feature I now can't add new songs in-between that change up the flow of the playlist. TL;DR: Add the ability to save a queue so I do not have to reshuffle a playlist and risk listening the same songs again and again.

title: Separate Profiles For Individual Users
author: FearlessKing
body: I use DnD for my own listening (indie, folk, rock, pop, etc.) but I also use it for background music when I host DnD games (atmospheric cinematic and video game music). It ends up splitting my usage about 50/50. This tends to give me a ridiculous wrapped and the AI DJ thinks I'm really into cinematic music for casual listening. Having different profiles is something that would benefit other styles of listening too. Exercise profile, driving profile, work profile, adult time profile, etc. I feel like wrapped and the AI DJ work best for people who listen to all their genres casually, but ultimately for people like us who curate different areas of life with different music it leads to a jumbled mess for finding new music suggestions. I'm sure this is not an easy thing to implement but doing so would be extremely useful for a lot of us.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Add an alternative german translation without "gender star"
author: Sacer
body: Even though this idea: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Please-let-me-disable-the-stupid-Genderstern/idi-p/546... got closed with a reference to another closed issue here: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/All-Platforms-Other-Please-make-genderstar-in-german-l... I just want to open it again. The approach of ideologized language does not fit the valid rules of the german language and therefore it disturbs the whole experience with your service if language settings are set to "German". Please understand that noone want's to cancel that custom version of the german language a minority of people share and use (it's actually only 10% of the population). We just want to have the native german language added back as an option. This wouldn't be so hard as you only have to remove everyting like "*innen". I'd volunteer for the job of i18n that, if it's a matter of staff costs. Just don't ignore over SEVENHUNDRED upvotes for that idea! Please consider that idea. It's not hard to implement and would make the experience of Spotify better for the majority of your german customers. Thanks! inb4: I'll open that idea again, and again, and again. So please at least TRY to dialogue with us.

title: Can we get a slider to change the volume for each ear individually?
author: henryr2005
body: I'm hearing impaired mostly in my left ear. This means that when I'm listening to music hear the right ear a lot clearer, as a music lover this leads to issues when songs pan parts to my left ear. I do have a hearing aid but headphones are never big enough to get the sound into the mic and I have to have them on at an angle. If the volume in my left ear was louder than in my right then I think it would make my whole experience a lot more enjoyable. What do you think?

title: [Amazon] Accessibility for blind and low vision users - make the app compatible with VoiceView
author: scoon77
body: My Uncle is blind and was looking forward to using the Spotify app on the Fire TV Stick that I got him for Christmas last year. We were looking forward to using the Spotify app with the Fire TV VoiceView Narration feature-he relies on the narration feature because of his visual impairment. Glitch... Please update the app to properly work with the Fire TV VoiceView narrator feature. If possible let us know when your app is updated to function properly. title: Songs are being removed from my library?
author: ignis_fatuus
body: (defaulted to wrong forum; repost) I'm going to copy/paste user 2Madi's post form another thread (the query was inexplicably closed) because they sum up the issue pretty well and it's been driving me crazy for a year now: "On many occations i've noticed that some songs that I have on my playlist aren't there anymore. I have one main playlist with all the songs that I like and sometimes I add songs to the playlist to make sure that I have them there, expecting to see the notification pop up where it says that the song is already there and ask if I want to skip duplicates but it doesn't and I am 100% sure that i've had that song in the playlist before and listened to it in this playlist specifically.I have searched for the song in the playlist to see if I have it but from another album because that happens sometimes but a lot of times I don't have the song at all even though I am 100% certain that it's supposed to be there. I've noticed as well that my old playlist that I had years ago had over 2000 songs but now it only has 1000. Can it have something to do with spotify changing the directories of the songs like if the song is in an album they remove the single and if I have the single in my playlist it gets removed? Or if an artist release a deluxe version of an album and spotify removes the regular album because it doesn't need to be there anymore when the deluxe album is there and better, and if I have songs on my playlist from that album they will be removed from my playlist? That's my theory but I don't know, all I know is it's very annoying.Does anyone know the reason or if there is any way to solve it?Thanks!" For example, Stones Throw Records has a playlist called "Junie". I saved Susie Thundertussy from there months ago. Go to check today because I hadn't heard the song in awhile and I was able to re-add it from that particular playlist when it should have already been in my library. What is going on?

title: Track Recording Date
author: david100
body: Please add the date a track was recorded, preferably by adding a column or, alternatively, by adding a "properties" or similar category to track right-click options. Jazz and classical enthusiasts would find this particularly interesting and helpful, because a particular artist may have recorded different performances of the same piece at different stages of his/her career, and the information used to be available on vinyl LP covers. I'm not interested in CD/track issue dates of previously recorded material as the dates are irrelevant to the original recording date. It's possible that jazz and classical enthusiasts, particular those of us old enough to have grown up with vinyl, are only a small proportion of Spotify's customers - but I hope there are enough of us to get this idea accepted.

title: [iOS] Implement Native HomePod Support
author: robotoman22
body: DetailsJust this week at WWDC (June 22, 2020), Apple announced support for third party music services on the HomePod. I'm requesting that Spotify implement native support for the HomePod such that one or even multiple HomePods will appear in the "Connect to a device" menu on any Apple device WITHOUT having to connect through Airplay. This will also allow users to ask Siri to play songs from Spotify on their HomePod(s). Apple is opening up the HomePod, and I know there are many other HomePod users that would love to have native Spotify support on their speaker. ResourcesWWDC 2020 video and further resources about this topic: https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2020/10061More details on this site: https://developer.apple.com/siri/Form to request music service integration from Apple: https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/sirikit-media-intent-for-homepod Please upvote this idea to garner attention for it. Thank you Spotify and the Spotify community. Let's get this implemented so it's ready for general iOS 14 release this September!

title: [All Platforms] Changelog after each Update (In-App)
author: liamwhear
body: With each new update, no matter what gets added or taken away, there is a curious lack of accountability from the actual staff, and the (paying) userbase are left confused. Why can we not drag from iTunes into our playlists anymore? Why can we not order our playlist columns as we see fit? So a detailed, easily accessible, log after each update would sort this. In this log should be a list of all the changes made with each update, and with the reasons why the changes were made. This is most important. We pay for this service. Why should we be left utterly confused with each update? We're left to scurry over to this forum, where your lackeys (who actually aren't on the development team) have no choice but to say 'I don't know' to each question, and with each request to implement back a feature in the Ideas section, the only response is 'This is not a priority'. What's wrong with some honesty, eh?
status_message: Updated on 2018-10-03Hey,Thanks for coming to the Spotify Idea Exchange with your feedback. We're keeping this status as 'Not Right Now' for the time being.Right now, we don't have plans to implement a detailed change log with both changes and reasoning behind it for every app update. For news about updates we've made, please keep an eye here on the Idea Exchange as well as on ourÂ News Blog.Â  Â  We appreciate you sharing your thoughts, and we'll check back in here if we have any other info.Thanks.

title: [Other] Bookmark audio books and separate them from music
author: murpsel
body: Please implement bookmarks for audio books and separate them from music.________________________There was an idea for bookmarks in audio books. Sadly it was closed, because one half of the idea (save the position in podcasts) has been implemented, even though nearly all of the 30 pages was about people wanting this for audio books. As the moderator posted "If you'd like to see the same behaviour for audio books, we'd recommend making a new Community Idea for this.", so this is it. There are many other audio book bookmarks requests, but they were all closed as duplicates because of the now closed idea. As an additional aspect to this, please ensure a separate handling / tagging of audio books and music. When alternating between listening to audio books and music the Spotify engine starts putting book chapters in your recommendation playlists, which doesn't make any sense whatsoever. 01/2023: It's astonishing that Spotify keeps steadfast in ignoring this simple and annoying issue. Getting a best of 2022 list with chapters of audio books still isn't a good idea.

body: I often use my iPad, via mobile hotspot, as a â€œremote controlâ€ for the Spotify app running on my iPhone (which has the data plan). This allows me to switch tracks, like music, etc. while working on the iPad without having to use my limited mobile hotspot data. However, â€œhidingâ€ a track from a list (daily mix, radio etc.) does not transfer from the iPadâ€™s playlist to the current playlist running on the iPhone. Therefore, â€hide songâ€ also does not force a skip to the next track. Similarly, hidden tracks on the iPhone are not displayed as such on the iPad. This makes curating lists of music using multiple devices frustrating at best. Itâ€™s important to note that â€œlikingâ€ a track does in fact immediately sync to the other devices and therefore hiding a track should also be possible. Thank You. Add on: Also, please fix â€œhide songâ€ so that it syncs to all playlists throughout my account. If I donâ€™t want to hear a song, I NEVER want to hear it again. This alone makes listening to multiple Daily Mixes unbearably annoying at times.

title: [Mobile] Remove current Song from Playlist
author: Hansholz
body: Hi This is a usability improvement for the Mobile devices. Sometimes I want to remove songs from a playlist. This is currently quite a long task to perform on the mobile device. I first have to select the right playlist.Then I have to locate the song, which is not listed alphabetically. They are listed in the order I built the playlist with the oldest first and newest last.Some of my playlists have up to 900 songs in them and scrolling slowly can be difficult and timeconsuming.Then click on the "pencil" icon and delete the track I don't want.I think it would be a better user experience if we could delete songs as easy as it is to add them to a playlist. So here's a suggestion for the mobile app, look there's even a space for it on the info page! Cheers J _____________________UPDATE 3 June 2017I have been contacted by user eviljojo22 who has developed a Plugin that creates a playlist named "Remove from Spotify" and every 45 minutes minutes it deletes every song in it and also in every playlist in which that same song appears (which may not be what you want). However, this is an option that may help you before Spotify gets round to providing this very simple function. Good luck (and Thank you EvilJojo22)Connect on https://spotify-playlist.eivo.fr _____________________UPDATE 7 February 2019I have been contacted by user bamboony who has developed an android app that might solve the problem in the short term:https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.bamboomy.delete.deletespotifytrack _____________________UPDATE 15 February 2022They delivered! This feature now exists. Click the three dots while playing a track and select the option "Remove from this Playlist"
status_message: Updated on 2022-07-19 Hey folks,Â  Â  If you'd like to remove the song that's currently playing on Android devices, you can quickly get to it by tapping the title of the playlist (located in the top center of the screen). This will open the playlist and the current song will be highlighted in green. From there, you can tap the three-dot menu and select "Remove from this playlist".Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â  Â Â  Â  We'll keep this idea open and if there are any updates about adding a remove song button to the menu on the 'Now Playing View' or if we have some news regarding this option on iOS devices, we'll post them here. Remember that you can still add your votes here if this is something you'd like to see in the future. Â  Thanks!

title: [All Platforms] [Podcast] Individual Autoplay Settings
author: poplopo
body: I think Podcasts should have different settings for autoplay than music. With music, the most desired way to listen is to proceed to the next song automatically without having to select one. But that's not the way podcasts are generally consumed - it is a more deliberate process. And particularly because the default sorting of a podcast is to display them with the most recent podcast first, it's quite a disruption to listen to a podcast all the way through and it begins to play the "next" episode - which also happens to be an older one that you've probably already listened to. There should be a setting that users can select to only play one podcast at a time. When the podcast is done, I want to manually select which episode of which podcast to listen to next, not have it chosen for me - and I would bet that's a pretty common listening pattern.

title: [All Platforms] Consolidate duplicates
author: Kerumen
body: It would be nice if Spotify can recognize identical songs to avoid duplicates in your Liked songs and playlists. This is pretty common for songs released first as a single then within an album. For example, if you like the single one, the UI will not show the song as liked when you browse the album. And if you like the song in the album, you'll end up with a duplicated version in your library. This also happens a lot for songs that you listen in Daily Mix or Discover weekly. If it's not the exact same song you have already liked before, the UI is inconsistent and you can save a duplicate. Apparently, there is already an internal merge mechanism as the play counter is not split between the different versions of the songs. Maybe this can also be used to consolidate the UI. Repost of https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Your-Music-Remove-Duplicated-Songs/idi-p/4546787 which didn't get enough kudos.

title: [Web Player][Browse] Add "tabs" to spotify
author: lemon_scented
body: When I'm listening to a cool playlist, I usually come across a bunch of artists that I want to hear more from. This happens multiple times and I don't want to lose the playlist I was on (and where I was up to) while clicking around listening to bits and bobs from the artist. I currently use a notes document to add the artist name to, and in the past used a "temporary" playlist to add the song to, which I would later follow up on. Both definitely work for this, but in the perfect world where everything is beautiful and lovely, I would like: 1. To open an artist in a 'tab' to come back to2. Click around and listen to lots of little snippets3. Take actions like adding songs to a playlist, starting a radio, etc4. Close the tab knowing that the work is done and they are in my listening loop, smiles all 'round5. Resume the playlist I was listening to originally

title: [All Platforms] Option to have a true shuffle.
author: jonathanleyerle
body: So Iâ€™ve been noticing more and more recently that Spotifyâ€™s default shuffle feature doesnâ€™t fully shuffle your songs. It does some sort of grouping to try to get similar songs together based off of what Iâ€™m sure is dozens of factors. Every time I shuffle a playlist (the one I noticed this with the most is ~100 songs and 6 hours of mostly full albums) it will group the songs mostly or completely together by album/artist, and given the number of times Iâ€™ve re-shuffled and checked the order thereâ€™s no way itâ€™s just a coincidence. They also generally seem to be in the same order as well. If I hit shuffle play on a playlist itâ€™ll generally put the same artists at the beginning every time. With larger playlists of albums I am really not a fan of this shuffling method. If I have 6 hours of music on a playlist I will hardly ever have 6 hours to actually listen through the whole thing, but when I do listen to it I would like to hear all of the music on it equally, and not just the artist or two your algorithm likes to shuffle to first. Anyways, Iâ€™m a reasonable man, all Iâ€™m asking for is an option to have a true shuffle (take all songs in the list, put them in a random order, and once theyâ€™re all played reshuffle them and play them again). Make it premium only if you want. I donâ€™t think you should scrap the current shuffle algorithm because it sucks. Looking at some of the suggestions on here it seems like some people lobbied hard to have it that way. Just add an option for a true shuffle for those of us that donâ€™t care about potentially getting the same song twice in a row.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Button on play queue to shuffle current selections
author: zardox
body: Currently, in the panel "Playing from play queue" below "Now playing," if there are any selections queued, there is a listing titled "Next in Queue" with one option "Clear Queue". My request - Add an additional button labeled "Shuffle", have it appear only if there is more than one selection in the queue. Pressing this "shuffle" button does a random sort of the selections currently in the queue. Note : selections below in the "Next from" section are not included, no change is made to their order. I need this because I routinely make a selection of singles and albums from several artists but I want then to shuffle the selections. This is kind of like building a playlist on the fly. An alternate idea would be to have a button that transfers selections in the queue to a playlist. But that is less preferable because I don't want a new playlist to be added

title: [Desktop] Popout player
author: angryhufflepuff
body: I have seen this idea posted several times over the years and they are all marked closed. I personally find it really frustrating that people have clearly been asking for this and over and over been denied, especially because it seems like a rather simple feature. Anyway, on the web player on Chromebook, there is an excellent popout player that remains on top of other tabs and windows you open, has the album/song art and has simple controls like pause, play, skip, and rewind that show when you hover over it. You can also move it around your screen so you position it where is easiest for you. It's crazy to me that this feature hasn't been implemented already for the desktop application, or if it has then the fact that it's been removed. It's super annoying to have to stop what I'm in the middle of to open the Spotify window just to see what is playing, or to skip or save a song. Something with just the basics of these features would make a huge difference and make usability so much easier.

title: [All Platforms][Music] HiFi Quality - Lossless Streaming 16bit 44.1khz
author: timiambeing
body: I've just started a trial of Qobuz - they offer the standard 320kbps as well as lossless FLAC streaming (and high res downloads if you purchase them) the sound quality is noticeably better and on classical it's just wonderful to get all that resolution through your hi-fi or headphones! The catalogue has a way to go to get to Spotify's level, but they are getting there. The iPad app isn't' too bad (the desktop app is in need of an upgrade but I hear they are putting all their efforts into mobile apps right now). So - lossless streaming - if Qobuz can do it then so can Spotify, they must have the same source - and obviously if you are asking Â£20 a month then those record labels and distributors take enough notice to make the high res tracks available for streaming. What this all means is soon, very soon, we will get lossless streaming and closely followed by high res downloads - but if Spotify aren't careful it will be Apple who get there first with an audiophile premium offering, and when they do it will be a much harder market place to make money in! ** please don't lump this suggestion with the main one on lossless downloads, that's a different idea entirely guys!

title: [Playlists] Ability to link together Tracks in Playlists
author: bvacaliuc
body: Hi, Wouldn't it be great if you could "pair"/"link"/"lock" or "chain" tracks together in a playlist? Then even if you shuffle-played, certain songs would always play together. mock-up of how linking/pairing a song might work. This idea was actually started by @Sartoris in 2012: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Ability-to-link-together-tracks-in-playlists-also-for-... But in 2015 it was closed as not having enough votes. Coincidentally, about the same time, I signed up for Spotify premium. As I listened to all the songs I've "liked" with shuffle, the one thing that kept coming into my mind was the terrible feeling you get when a song that is meant to follow another is not played. You get the feeling of being violated; it is a terrible experience. As I searched for this feature, I saw that idea was marked inactive and decided to open it again. That idea had gotten 138 likes in 2015 and as of January 2020 has gotten another 116 for a total of 255. There were another 18 ideas then that all linked to the one above (see attached). So I re-submitted this idea in 2015 and since then you wonderful people have given it over 880 votes! Thank you! From the rules, we see that we needed to have over 500 votes to keep the topic alive in monthly discussions (check!). We also see that we need 100 votes per year to keep it alive (check again!). So we're in good shape on that front. Now we have to see what we need to do to get it moving forward from "Not Right Now" to "Under Consideration". Again, from the rules above, Spotify says that they use these criteria:Helping artists.Data and other information we've collected.Information from research testing, focus groups, and surveys.Feedback in the Community and other support channels. (That's us!)Our overall short- and long-term business strategy.Hmm. Ok. So I would say that playing tracks that are meant to be together really helps the artists because their work is rendered in the correct way that they intended. I'm wondering how many artists are dying inside when their specially arranged songs are cut up because someone shuffled their playlist? I can't speak to Spotify's data and research, focus groups and surveys, or about their business strategy. However, it occurs to me that anything that affects the order of which song plays can affect revenue because Spotify pays someone when a song gets played and they don't pay the same amount of $ for every song... Sure its a tiny fraction of a cent, but it adds up. So my first guess is that Spotify's hesitation to implement this idea is economic. I think we should continue the discussion along these lines to see if we could come up with some kind of consensus on this notion. Letting a song "pair" with another in a playlist would be enough to make a lot of people happy. Would we be willing to put some $ behind having this feature? Lets say Spotify charged you $0.01 (a cent) everytime you were shuffle playing and the queue hit a linked song and played the one that came after it. Would you be ok with that? If not, what would make it ok? I think answering the economic question is one thing that is keeping this idea from moving forward. @wsmyth commented in May 2019 that he would be willing to spend $1/month for this feature. I would do that too, would you? From the many, many great comments, @WesleyM77 posted in April 2019 a link to a US Patent. There are two patents, actually, [US8214740B2] and [US9396760B2]. Reading through the two patents, it's clear that they cover this idea in many of its possible methods. So apart from the economic impact, Spotify may be prevented by the patent holder from implementing this feature. It has been noted that only one service has this feature, and now this explains it. The patents expire in 2030. So, here we are. We want a feature, someone has successfully patented the feature and so we can't have nice things. Everyone including the patent holders want to make money, so is there a price that Spotify could negotiate with the patent holder and then pass on to the users that would be acceptable to all parties? Spotify, would you look into this and get back to us? Thanks very much! -bogdan linkingSongs.pdf

title: [Discover] Find public Playlists that contain Song/Artist
author: ryeguy_24
body: My theory (not rocket science): If someone else's playlist includes a song or artists that I like, there is a good change that I will enjoy the rest of their playlist. Currently, you can only search for public playlists via playlist name. Considering that most people do not name their playlists to accurately reflect the type of music it contains, I believe that the current search functionality is quite limited. Spotify should have functionality to search for public playlists that contain a song/artist. I think would be immensly helpful for music discovery. Best of luck, Ryan P.S. - Down the line, it would be interesting to see "similarity scores" between two playlists. Could be quite interesting for finding new music.

title: [iOS][Your Library] Quickly listen/shuffle all liked songs (including albums/releases) by artist
author: shoelessyo
body: This ability used to be on Spotify, but was recently removed - or is a bug. I am using the iOS mobile app. Latest app version and iOS. Setup:For an artist, I might "like" some songs - adding them to my Liked Songs playlist - as my favorites. But I also "like" some of the artist's albums even though I don't want all those songs in my Liked Songs playlist. Good so far. Problem:When viewing an artist page, right below the header there is a section that says:You liked10 songs, 4 releasesSay those 4 releases result in another 20 songs. I use to be able to click that line and then shuffle play all 30 songs. But starting recently only the 10 liked songs will play. And if 0 songs are liked, it will show "4 releases" and then not play anything at all when clicking the Play button on the next page! Since I download all my liked songs and albums to avoid using cell data for streaming, I tried turning Offline playback mode on. Then I see this on the artist page:Downloaded songs30 songsDecent duct tape work-around - right? I should be able to click on that line and then shuffle play all 30 downloaded songs... but it doesn't work. It actually only plays the 10 liked songs. Even if this did work, it is still a clunky "solution" - it really should work the same way when Offline mode is off - like it used to work. Solution:I just want to easily listen to all the songs and albums I've liked for an artist. I understand this is not a perfect solution either but is better than the current options.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Customizable sleep timer
author: NazKhan
body: Spotify has the option of putting on a sleep timer while listening to podcasts. I love this feature and use it often. The time increments go from five minutes, 10 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes to an hour. It would be nice to also have a customizable timer, much like audible does for their audiobooks. The 15 minute increments are a little long and it would be nice to sometimes put on a timer for 25 minutes or 30 minutes, etc. You could also put the option 'until the end of the playlist'.

title: [Playlists] Turn Off/Remove/Opt Out of "Your Episodes"
author: user-removed
body: Currently, downloaded podcasts are automatically added to the "your episodes" playlist (whether you want them there or not). They are not automatically removed when you un-download them. Additionally, is a pain to remove each episode from the playlist, you have to perform at least three steps. This feature, as it currently exists, serves little more purpose than to be a duplicate of the "downloads" tab. In sum, users should be able to choose whether or not they utilize the "your episodes" playlist feature and have greater control over how it functions.

title: [Desktop][Developer] Spotify for Windows on Arm (Win32) Desktop app badly needed
author: bradavon
body: Can you tell me when Spotify will be released for Windows on ARM and where on your Roadmap it is? Windows on ARM PCs have been out a few years now and whilst the 32-Bit Windows App works, due to software emulation not optimally. Apple announced on the 22nd of June Macs are moving to ARM starting the end of the year and they expect the transition away from Intel to ARM to take 2 years. Both Microsoft and Adobe are working on ARM compatibility. Currently on my Microsoft Surface Pro X I have to use the 32-Bit download which lags. A new idea was posted for this last year but it's been closed as it didn't get enough Likes but it didn't get enough Likes as it's been closed ðŸ˜• - https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Desktop-Compile-Spotify-for-ARM64-windows/idi-p/478113... Thanks
status_message: Updated on 2022-05-30 Hey everyone, Â  As announced previously, the beta release is now ready and can be downloaded fromÂ THIS LINK. Â  Please uninstall any any previous versions of Spotify and install the Arm beta from the link above. Before doing so, make sure that youâ€™re indeed using an Arm processor. Â  The current version isÂ 1.1.86.857. There may be subsequent updates which will work much like those on the Desktop app. Â  There is currently one known issue with this release - some video Podcast episodes can't be played and trying to do so results in an error message about updating the Spotify client version.Â There is a workaround to this for those of you who want to play this content, but also want to test the beta and help us improve it. Just go to theÂ ShareÂ option in the menu, copy the Web link and paste it in your browser to then watch it there in the web player instead. title: [Partnership] Add Sign-in with Google for Existing Spotify Users
author: mmichonski
body: Thanks, Spotify, for adding a Sign-in with Google button option. However, only new Spotify users creating a new account can currently use this feature. There is no current way to port over an existing Spotify account with all its great listening history and fine tuned song preferences into a new Spotify account. This leaves existing Spotify users with the only way to use this feature being to create a brand new Spotify account. Could you extend the Sign-in with Google feature to prior existing Spotify accounts, so that every Spotify user who wishes to can use it?

title: [iOS] Siri Shortcuts Support
author: brutedawg
body: PREFACE: With the release of iOS 12, iPhone users can now utilize Shortcuts to make the most of their daily routines by automating tasks and steps in both native and third party apps. Currently, the extent to which Spotify can be utilized via Shortcuts is to simply Open App. IDEA: I wish to see more options and a wider scope of utility of Spotify in Shortcuts to the capacity of playing specific playlists when I leave my home, and adding the current song to a new custom playlist that I can name, or even copying a song link to a tweet. I know the Shortcut app would be capable of handling a workflow along those lines but it seems it would require a bit more generosity from the Spotify app. MODERATORS: Please note that this is NOT the same idea requested here considering that post is requesting for "Siri Integration" not "Shortcut Support". In addition, this idea is no longer an announcement as prefaced here and is now a public feature in iOS 12 as of Monday (9/17).

title: [Music] Custom Start & Ending Times for a Track
author: krth8
body: Hi. I'm a big electronic music lover and there is only one feature i would like added to spotify. The option to choose a part of the track i would like to play and have the settings saved. In the world of electronic music there is almost allways 2-3 minute build ups, and not many radio mixes of each track. This can be a problem when having a party and a track lasts for 7 minutes with 3 of them is a buildup that not everyone would like to listen to. It would be nice to have a feature like this that i can change on each track, just drag 2 buttons to a start and end point. and maybe have a 3-5 second fade on where i choose to set them. Made a quick illustration on what i mean.

title: [iOS] Bring back Chronological Scroll
author: koorscolors
body: In the new version of Spotify (with DJ, smart shuffle) I noticed that the ability to scroll quickly and chronologically was gone from â€˜liked songsâ€™. While those other features are awesome; I really miss this scrolling feature and I am unsure why it was removed. There are two reasons I feel this should be brought back:1. Scrolling chronologically (ie with the date and a scrollbar) allowed me to quickly find music. For example, I flew to the Philippines in summer 2019 and there was a song I listened to constantly; the name of which I cant quite remember. I could quickly find it based on my memory of a date and event in my life.2. This scrolling feature allowed me to scroll quickly on mobile. Without it, if I want to navigate to the bottom of my liked songs list, I have to scroll with my finger for way to long until it almost physically hurts. If nothing else we need a scroll bar that eliminates 30 swipe up actions.

title: [iOS][Other] We should have the option to enable the spotify widget on lockscreen
author: inkaokarina
body: I think we should have the option to enable the spotify widget that is showed on your phone lockscreen whenever spotify is in use. I personally have accidentally skipped and paused songs multiple times because of this widget. Whenever you are on a walk or at the gym, you may have your phone in your hand or your pocket. If you have an iPhone, your phone probably turns on when the screen is touched and because the pause/skip buttons are in the middle of the screen, you may accidentally skip the song you were listening to. I also find it annoying that anyone who can see your lockscreen can see what you're listening to even when the phone is locked. So even without knowing your passcode or face ID (on iPhone) people can still see what you are listening to for example while checking the time on your phone. So basically you have no privacy whatsoever. I am not sure if I'm the only one with this problem but I would like a change to this.

title: [Mobile][Other] Play button on Artist Page should play only songs by that particular artist
author: The-Husk
body: I noticed this recently with the mobile app while playing songs on Slipknot's artist page, when all of the sudden a song by Murderdolls, a side-project by one of Slipknot's members Joey Jordison, started playing. I was like "Wait, this isn't Slipknot?", but thought's it's just an accident, so I ignored it at first. Then it happened again and again, and when I checked the queue I found that it was ridden with songs from other bands that members from Slipknot have participated in. Why is that? When I play songs from the artist page, I expect to hear ONLY songs by that particular artist. This doesn't happen on the desktop app or the web player, so why would it happen in the mobile app? The inconsistency, it just doesn't make any sense. And don't rush to close this as just yet another content request, as it's more feature-oriented, since this behavior is clearly intentional, for god knows what reason, and I'm sure it happens with other artists as well. So please, get rid of this feature and make the Play button on artist page actually play songs by that particular artist only like it does on all other platforms!

title: [Mobile] Please bring back the old group session. "Play from same device"
author: tgerhardt1
body: The old group session, "play from same device option" has been removed and it has saddened many people. It seems the only group session option is now remote group sessions, where the music is played on each individual device. This group session, "play from same device" feature was personally one of my favorite features of Spotify. When it was first introduced, I quite literally showed all of my friends to use it. I understand it was in beta, but this feature was used by many people, quite literally all the time. We know this feature did not work perfectly, but we would use it regardless of the tiny flaws, it was honestly my favorite thing about Spotify. Whenever I, or any group, would have friends over, I would always offer to start a group session so that everyone could contribute to the music being played. Having this option, friends could seamlessly contribute to the music being played so that one person would not selfishly play music the entire time. It was so fun having everyone able to contribute, without having to hand over the one single phone to everyone that was connected to the device, just to add a few songs to the queue. Having someone scan a code and then instantly able to add songs to the queue was a perfect idea for hanging out with friends, in person. It appears with the new update, there is only an option for remote group sessions where the music is played on each individual device, I'm asking to consider bringing back the "play from same device." To recap, this feature allowed people to share music during in-person hang sessions, and from the people I had introduced to it, all found it to be one of the most fun features of Spotify. So, dear Spotify, please bring back this feature! Thanks,Troy and many others!!

title: Albums & Playlists: Have BOTH Play & Shuffle buttons at the top
author: MattSuda
body: Albums and Playlists should have BOTH a Play Button and a Shuffle Button at the top in the mobile and desktop apps Some users want to easily play the list in order and other users want to play it in shuffle. Some buttons are currently play and some are shuffle. Why not put both buttons there so we can choose if we want to shuffle it or play it? Right now to play in order you can press or click on the first item in the list, but with the different types of play buttons this is still confusing for most users. Shuffle can also be controlled by clicking on the shuffle button on the now playing screen. Right now the play buttons are inconsistent across all of the Spotify apps. On mobile it was recently changed so now when you go to album pages, the button at the top is no longer a shuffle play button but instead a regular play button. Playlists still have the shuffle play button on mobile. On desktop all play buttons are regular play buttons and do not shuffle. See how confusing that is? Why not do like other music apps already do and have both a PLAY and SHUFFLE option buttons at the top of the playlist or album. Problem solved, you get to pick how you want to play it. Doesn't make sense how inconsistent it is currently. I never use the play buttons because you never know if it's going to shuffle or regular play. I just click the first song in the list to play the songs in order usually and if I want to shuffle I just turn shuffle on from the now playing view. For artist pages you can just leave it the way it is now with only a shuffle play button since playing in order wouldn't make sense. You could still add it and pressing the play button would play their most recent releases in order. If you end up keeping the shuffle button then change the icon on it to a shuffle instead of the play with the little shuffle icon underneath it. This is how it would look like at the top of the album and playlist pages in the mobile app. It would look similar in the desktop app too. Keywords: Adele album shuffle play button change
