title: [Desktop][Your Library] Unpin Liked Songs Playlist
author: Inudesu
body: In the Library, Liked Songs are pinned (and the icon is like four times larger than the others). "Your Episodes" is the same for podcasts.Other playlists (and podcasts) are sort-able in a variety of ways. But these are pinned right at the top. For those of us that don't use spotify that way (even if spotify would like for us to do so), it would be better if the "liked songs" playlist was treated like all the other playlists and could be sorted down alphabetically or recently played or custom (same for "your episodes"). I don't need (strangely larger than normal) empty playlists or folders right at the top of my library. If you don't want to let us delete them (or just have them not appear unless there is something in there) it seems like at the very least they should be sort-able like every other playlist. Even for those who really like and use these categories, the option to sort would still allow them to keep them pinned right at the top as they are now. (it should be down under "L" if I select this)(I don't know what this would do for me - make it disappear altogether?) (this would result it in being placed down at the bottom, since I don't use it). I thought maybe this was a bug when the update happened some time back, but it's apparently by design. It just doesn't make sense to me that we'd be forced to keep an empty playlist with an enormous icon pinned at the top of the library that I have to just scroll past every time I try to select a playlist. Giving us the option to move it wouldn't harm anyone who uses it.

body: Introducing: Spotify Clean Spotify Clean is pretty much spotify, but all the songs are clean/radio edit versions of the songs available on normal spotify. Every song is available, and when a cuss word comes on it is simply edited/cut out. This can be made possible by AI, and would be targeted towards younger audiences and family accounts. This quality of life update is sure to be utilized, and could potentially be the reason someone chooses to make a spotify account instead of a Pandora or Amazon Music account. I'm positive Spotify will hop on the AI train and include more features using AI tools. This could be a major one that would be sure to gain publicity.

title: [Mobile] Bring back Thumbs up/down in radio
author: lavieenrose
body: Spotify took away the thumbs up and down options on radio stations. Does that make you as mad as I am. I spent dozen of hours optimizing all my radio stations and now they are useless as Spotify basically plays whatever they want to play on them. It's become just like one of their own playlist. Gone all my beautiful radio stations. I chatted with customer support and here is what they said: "Sorry to hear you're missing your thumbs up and down Radio, and I can see backstage this is due to the recent Spotify update. We're always testing things by adding or removing features to make Spotify better overall." If you are dissatisfied, help get this feature back by liking this post. Thanks!

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Change Folder Image
author: chalandra
body: Hello, I recently found out about folders again on Spotify! It's such a great feature to organize my 50+ playlists that have either been made myself, made by others, or made by Spotify. Another great feature is changing the playlist picture on desktop! It gives me the creative freedom to spruce up my playlists in the best way; however, it is an eyesore on mobile. I believe that Spotify should implement a feature to let users modify folder pictures on desktop (Hopefully they will implement changing either on mobile...) along with playlist pictures. Yes, this idea has been submitted many times, but I hope that this time it can have enough kudos! Thank you for reading!

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Delete Songs from Account History
author: juniper7997
body: There should be a way for me to control my history of songs played. Sometimes I accidentally play things I don't want to hear or I try listening to songs I don't like. I should be able to remove them from my history so that my stats are accurate for song and music suggestions. Also....My account was hacked and someone played music I would never listen to. I can't delete those songs from my history. I can only remove them from my recently played section. I DON'T LIKE THAT! I tried to ask a customer service agent to delete the songs, but they said it couldn't be done. Wow! Move to the 21st century, Spotify, and give your customers some more control. Sheesh!

title: [Desktop][Search] Queue tracks directly from Quick Search using a hotkey
author: Jake0
body: Idea:As a user, I want to use a hotkey to add a track to the queue, directly from Quick Search. Context:The Quick Search feature lets users very quickly find and play tracks using only the keyboard.Quick Search does not support the Right Click menu on (Mac) Desktop, so users cannot queue songs directly from it.Quick Search already has several hotkeys, including [Shift]+[Enter] to immediately play a track. (See screenshot) But not yet one to add a track to the queue. Previous suggestionsWhen this idea was posted previously it was removed because it would be too similar to the following:Add an "Add to Queue" shortcut for desktopHowever this requests (1) a button, not a shortcut and (2) it asks for it to be in the general overviewKeyboard Hotkey to queue Track(s) However this request is about browsing a playlist, not the Quick Search. When in fact Quick Search is very much intended to be used with the keyboard and actually already has specific shortcuts.

title: [Playlists] Solution to false/abusive reporting
author: CloudlightRec
body: Whenever someone reports a playlist - the title and cover art are removed immediately. This is often abused to hurt record labels and playlist curators. After contacting support - the account of someone who abused this system gets taken down. This person then creates another email and free Spotify account and repeats the process. There is a simple solution to the problem - enable reporting feature only after 10 hours of music/podcasts were streamed using the account. It won't change the experience for a normal user but makes copyright abuse impractical. It's cheap and easy to implement and would stop 95% of false claims. Thank you for your consideration.

title: [All Platforms][Other] 2-Factor Authentication
author: ThomasVH
body: Spotify should, as a matter of good practice and safety, implement 2-step authentication. Previously, Spotify enabled the option to log out other sessions other than the current session. This would prevent hackers from stealing accounts, which would additionaly lead to less account hacks and less work for Spotify employees to assist in these cases. More info: https://twofactorauth.org
status_message: Updated on 2018-10-18Hi everyone, thanks for bringing us your feedback in the Spotify Idea Exchange.Â Weâ€™re ready to mark this idea as â€˜Under Considerationâ€™.Â  Â  We are currently investigating various solutions for account security for our users, e.g. 2-factor authentication. Any news regarding user-facing security updates will be posted to this thread as a status change. title: AI DJ needs to be able to tailor music playlists to activity
body: The AI DJ is great in giving the listener a complete selection of different music from past and present artists. Love the concept. I suggest that when the DJ starts that an activity screen or the DJ asks what activity the listener is doing during that time. The music playlist then can be tailored to that activity. The DJ played some great relaxed chill music when I was working out but that music was not what I was wanting during that time. I pressed the DJ button to change the playlist. Now when I am relaxing I am not getting any chill music due to my changing the playlist. I think having the ability to have music specifically for certain activities will enhance the experience. Have the DJ mode be able to change playlists also when the activity changes. Perhaps have the ability for the listener to press the DJ button and request a new playlist for the new activity.

title: [Podcasts] Auto-Updating Podcast Playlists/Routines
author: RedRoevr
body: Every morning, I have a number of daily news podcasts that I enjoy listening to in the same order every time. The way I currently go about this routine is by starting to play the latest episode from the first podcast, then adding the latest episode of the second and third (and so on...) podcasts to the que so they play in the order I choose. This feels pretty tedious, so I attempted to create a playlist with these podcasts in the order I like to listen to them everyday. However, I seem to only be able to add specific episodes to the playlist, not the show itself. Which means I can create the perfect playlist for THIS morning, but by TOMORROW morning it will not have updated to the latest episodes and be out of date. And so, therein lies my idea... The ability to create an auto-updating playlist of podcasts (not podcast episodes) in the order I choose. I see it resembling something like the "Routines" one can set on the Amazon Alexa app. For example, when a particular custom phrase is spoken, a preset number of actions occur in the order they were set. Translated to Spotify: You press the play button on a podcast playlist, and a preset selection of latest episodes play in the order they were set. Similar to the "Daily Drive" playlist, but with the ability to customize exactly what I want to hear. Based on how I like to use Spotify, this idea being implemented would significantly improve my ease of use and enjoyment of the app. Thanks for reading.

title: [iOS][Developer] Apple Watch Needs Standalone Spotify App(Needs votes)
author: nkittles4
body: Hey Spotify, As a 13-year-old with an Apple Watch set up using Family Sharing, I'm a huge fan of Spotify. However, I'm disappointed that the watch app can't function without an iPhone, and I've tried to set up a backup device using an iPhone 6s, but it's not compatible with iOS 16. I'm hoping that the developers at Spotify will consider implementing a code screen similar to the one found on Wear OS, Google's operating system. This would make a tremendous difference for me and other users, and would allow us to continue using Spotify without needing an iPhone. The implementation of such a feature would be relatively straightforward - all it would require is removing the app store requirement and adding the code screen. Cheers,Noah [update] others have posted the same things view them at https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Spotify-on-Standalone-Apple-Watch/idi-p/5481948[Update 2] Im dreading saying this but I am about to switch to another service that has a watch app, I still love Spotify but this is incredible important

title: [Desktop][Podcasts] Change skip forward action on podcasts
author: cengen
body: I listen to a lot of podcasts on the Spotify app on a Mac. The headphones that I use have a skip forward or backward function if I swipe a finger on the headphones. When using the Apple Podcasts app, this skips the episode ahead or back by 30 seconds. When using Spotify, this action skips the entire podcast episode or brings me to the very beginning of the episode. title: [Mobile][Other] AI Queries
author: JstStynPositive
body: The best way I can explain it is a "search" mode for the AI to explore genres. Some form of a "search" button that has the AI introduce you to new music from that specific genre or artist, using what users with similar listening profiles like in it, then expanding to what regular listeners of those suggestions also listen to, etc., etc., just contained in the genre. The search button could be on the DJ screen or as an extra button when searching at the right of the search bar. The AI would process the genre, song, or track name, "categorize" it and expand upon it using the abovementioned method. I put categorize in quotes because I'm not sure the term best fits, but something along those lines. I love this dude, and such an exemplary implementation of AI in a new way!

title: [Other] Natural Language Processing for AI DJ
author: mjamesc07
body: I think this AI DJ has some great potential, and I understand it is in beta, but I think it would benefit from having more feedback options besides just "switching it up."In a perfect world, I would like to be able to, via text or voice, tell it what vibe I am in the mood for it going from there. Integrating some natural language processors would make it even more powerful. Example:"Good Morning; I need some high-energy, upbeat music to wake me up.""Will you play something similar but with a female vocalist?""It is nap time for the kids. Can you play some relaxing instrumentals?" That barely scratches the surface of interactions, but I feel like it is enough to get the idea across.

title: [Amazon Echo] Enable saving songs to playlists via Alexa voice commands
author: shakeheartbreak
body: Amazon Alexa is installed in millions upon millions of homes worldwide. And yet, the functionality available for it is sorely lacking compared to its implementation on Google Home and other "smart" speakers. Here's one example. Currently, it doesn't seem possible to save music to playlists via voice commands on Alexa. With Google, you can just say "Add this song to my music" and it'll immediately save it to your linked Spotify account. So can you add a simple voice command to your Alexa skill that will allow this? At the moment, users are having to rely on third party skills instead, such as: Song Keeper - https://www.amazon.co.uk/CAct-Song-Keeper-for-Spotify/dp/B079F69G67 Playlist Helper - https://www.amazon.co.uk/Civica-Playlist-Helper/dp/B08D6PM1YM/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=playlist+...

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Allow custom sorting of Your Episodes
author: fdlfddf
body: Your Episodes is a unique playlist that doesn't allow modifying the order of podcast episodes that have been saved using the (+) button. The only order to play is last-in-first-out (LIFO), which is inconvenient for a thousand different reasons. Instead of being able to order saved podcast episodes (for example, while doing a long road trip, where such fiddling while driving can be very dangerous), a user must interact with the interface after each episode plays in order to get to the next episode they desire, UNLESS somehow they added them in the exact right desired reverse-chronological order in the first place. This is especially frustrating since the Spotify (+) interface encourages users to add multiple episodes of the same podcast at a time because it is too hard to add them in the reverse-order you want to play them in (requires jumping around from podcast to podcast, extra scrolling, losing your place, etc), and if the listener's play order preference ever changes, there's no way to accommodate that new preference. Can we just get the same simple drag-n-drop interface for Your Episodes that exists for all other playlists? That would solve all these problems and make listening to podcasts via Spotify such a joy!
status_message: Updated on 2023-04-10Hello and thanks for submitting your idea to the Idea Exchange! Â  We've gone ahead and marked this as a new suggestion. Spotify Staff will look into this idea once it reaches the necessary amount of votes. Â  More info on how your feedback reaches Spotify via the Idea Exchange can be found here. Â  Cheers!

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] bring Canvas to other platforms (Desktop, Tablet, TV, consoles)
author: Beefitty
body: I, for one, actually like the Canvasing ideas on songs. To be honest, I wish there was more as I have my phone on a charging dock on my desk next to my monitor (audio bluetoothed to my stereo) and I can't help but think that the idea of the canvas should be expanded to tablets and the desktop app. I think its a nice surprise, even if its only a few seconds on a loop for the length of the song. I'm sure over time you'll add more to iconic songs of the past as you also keep adding them to newly released tracks.I see there are plenty of other users out there that don't particularly care for the option. That's fine; it's not for everybody. I still think it should be expanded upon. When I'm using airplay at home to listen to music, it always gets my attention when the canvases pop up, but this doesn't happen when I have my iPad on airplay, just iPhone. The canvas seems like a more lively visual compared to just a plain 'Now Playing' screen. Just something to consider. spotifygif.mp4

title: [Your Music] Creating "Collections" of Albums
author: Walrusman
body: I have an idea that could make using Spotify better for people who put a lot of effort into managing their music libraries (and for everyone else as well). Collections menu in Your Library The idea is simple: Being able to create collections or lists of whole albums. Of course you could just add albums to regular playlists but then it just adds the songs separately, which is messy, so you can't easily see which or how many albums are there in the list or checking if there are missing songs. You can add and remove whole albums to collections, much like songs to playlists By having album collections we could easily see which albums are added to them and it would make it quicker to select certain albums for downloading by toggling the download button of a collection containing them. We could also re-order the list of albums quicker than re-ordering a simple playlist of consecutive albums broken down to songs. This would also make it possible to listen to certain albums in a specific or even random order without having to add every album to the queue one by one. You can download/un-download every album in the collection with one tap, you can also either play the albums in order or shuffle them, or even shuffle all songs within the albumsAdding or removing albums from collections

title: [Android][Podcasts] Podcast Episode UX
author: Crunkleburg
body: Current UX:As an example, let's say you've recently got in to a podcast that started around 2010. At this age, a podcast will likely have over 600 episodes. If you decide to listen from the beginning, you can easily sort oldest to newest and start working through them from episode 1. Now after some time, you will be 100 or 200 episodes in. Now, when you open the podcast episode list, if you sort by oldest to newest, you will have to scroll through a couple hundred episodes to get to where you're at. When you're at around 300, you will have to start at either end and scroll through 300 episodes to get to where you are. Sometimes the Spotify Android app will jump to where you last were, however this seems to happen on very rare occasions for me. Improvement:For podcasts with hundreds of episodes, the episode list should be accessible through a drop down menu or similar UI element to separate episodes through more manageable chunks of episodes. As an example, selecting "Episodes 300-349" from a menu makes it much more manageable to scroll through and select my next episode. As it stands, I find the UX for podcasts with more than a couple hundred episodes to be pretty painful. I encourage the UX designers go to a long-running podcast and scroll 300 episodes one or two times a day as I find myself doing to get an idea of how this can be improved with a more granular organization structure.

title: [Mobile] Â«After QueueÂ» Sleeptimer Function
author: OleOmang
body: One feature that could be added to Spotify's sleep timer is the option to stop the music after the current queue is complete. Currently, users can set a timer to stop the music after a set number of minutes or after a single track has played, but there isn't an option to automatically stop the music once the current queue of songs has finished playing.Adding this feature would be particularly helpful for users who want to listen to a few set songs before heading to sleep or just want to listen to songs in different playlists from the queue without the music stopping in the middle of a track. To implement this feature, Spotify could add a new setting to the sleep timer menu that allows users to choose whether they want the music to stop after a set number of minutes, after a single track, or after the current queue is complete. Users could simply select the desired option, set the timer, and enjoy a fee of their favourite songs before heading to sleep.

title: [Web Player] Opening a song link should take you to the album it's from
author: Autoplay_is_Trash
body: This entire time I have been using Spotify, there has been a very logical system. You search for a song. You click on said song. It takes you to the album (or EP or whatever) that the song is from. Now in a recent update this has been changed so that clicking a song no longer shows you where it's from, but instead shows you the song's lyrics, followed by essentially the artist's main page, and then way at the bottom is the album it's from. This is entirely redundant as clicking the name of the artist already takes you to their main page which also shows you all their popular hits. If you're clicking on a specific song name, perhaps a deep cut, then you specifically want to know that deep cut, not their most popular hits. And like I said, you already have a link anyway that does the same thing, so it's unnecessary. For lyrics, there is similarly already a button at the bottom right of the player controls which you can click on to show lyrics. We don't need multiple links that do the same thing. To make matters more confusing, if you're currently playing a song, then clicking the link of the song in the bottom left corner will take you to the album it's from, as expected. So, to reiterate, clicking a link from search results or playlists takes you to a redundant, unwanted song page, but you can click on the song name to get the response you want if you are currently playing the song. This is a terrible change. I don't care about the lyrics. If I did, I could just press the button for them. But I do want the ability to be able to explore and discover other music while I'm still listening to something else. I also want the ability to quickly and easily see what album a song is from and where it is (track number) in it. In this new system, you would have to stop whatever it is you are listening to and play something else just to see what album it's from. The end user essentially loses the ability to explore new music while still listening to their current song, in exchange for two links that do the same end result of taking you to the artist's home page and showing you their pop hits. For the Record, I am not asking for a complete rollback. I happen to think changing the "heart" system to a plus is a good thing. Hearts are a silly way to communicate I just want to add an album to my library. A plus is a better design. I just want to keep Spotify the way it has always been that makes discovering new music and navigating to an album really easy. If this change is here to stay, I won't be. Spotify will lose one of its key advantages as the superior music streaming platform. Here is the bottom line, Spotify. You don't need complicated recommendation algorithms and privacy-defiling data collection to help people discover new music. We discover new music from other like-minded REAL PEOPLE who have made playlists on the platform of the genre we like. We can listen to songs from these playlists, and if we like them, we then check out some of the other songs on the album it's from, and that can grow into an appreciation for the artist's other works. In other words, search is always better than recommendations. Music is inherently personal. It defines us, it is an expression of our identity. Nobody wants to be told what to listen to by an a.i. bot. We want to be allowed to explore through the search function and discover new albums and new artists for ourselves. Losing the ability to link a new favorite song directly to its album hurts Spotify's role as a middleman connecting eager fans-to-be with artists who want to be heard.

title: [Playlists] Remove a song from a Blend and prevent similar songs
author: hmthws
body: I had a suggestion for the new Spotify Blends that came out for Spotify. I really like this new feature and I think Spotify has done a really good job with it! However, I listen to a genre that my friends do not like. I noticed that a lot of music of that genre appeared in my Spotify Blends even though I have other music in common with my friends that could appear instead. Right now, the only option is to 'hide the song' but that only works to hide the song from your own device. Can we have a 'remove from playlist' option for songs that we don't like in the Blend? Removing the song should ideally be permanent, and should work on the entire playlist on all devices. Also, once we remove songs from the Blend, then can it prevent similar songs/songs of that genre from appearing again in the Blend? It would be even better if right after we remove a song, it is instantly replaced by a song that is different from it like it is learning from the feedback. Thanks!

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Add the same song to multiple playlists simultaneously
author: conner_thewhite
body: There is no reason why Spotify shouldn't have a functionality on at least the desktop app where you can drag one song into as many "selected" playlists as you want and have that song added to all of them at the same timeâ€¦ Here's a little more info to back up this request: I'm, for one, the kind of person who obsesses over music, and a huge component of that is the way in which I organize my playlists. I believe it is probably safe to say that most people wish their music was better organized, but the primary reason why they aren't is simply the amount of time it takes to put together quality playlists. Instead, what most people end up with are a small handful of enormous playlist hundreds, if not thousands, of songs that have no rhyme or reason to why they are in the same playlists. To avoid this dilemma, I have spent hours and hours sorting through all my favorite songs and making different types of playlists that they may fit into. One thing I learned early on is that a particular song is likely going to fit into multiple playlists, and this is where the problem lies and the primary reason why most people avoid making well thought out playlists altogether. In order to add a song to all the playlists I want, I have to sit at my computer and continuously drag a new song I want put into different playlists into each individual one over and over again which, when organizing dozens or even hundreds of songs, can take an insane amount of unnecessary time. And that is if you happen to be creating and organizing playlists on the desktop appâ€¦ if you are trying to do this on your phone, you might as well forget about it - it would take you an hour to add 20 different songs to 10 different playlists. That is why I believe Spotify should add a function (starting on desktop and eventually moving onto mobile like they are likely to do with the "folders" for playlists) in which a single song can be added to multiple playlists at the same time. Attached is a picture originally posted by a subscriber named anaraee who had requested this a few years ago, but apparently wasn't able to get enough traction then... hopefully this time will be different.

title: [All Platforms] Separate Queues for Podcasts and Music
author: jeffreyfhow
body: Hi there,Would like to propose this again as it looks like related tickets were closed and not addressed.Just want to share a concrete example on why this would be helpful... Throughout the day I'm listening to either music (while working) OR podcasts (while commuting). If I'm commuting to work, I'd like to queue up podcasts to listen to while commuting. This includes coming back to the same podcast queue when I'm commuting home from work (ie. same queue in the morning and evening). The problem is, I listen to music during the day while I'm working. So I need to clear my podcast queue and then queue everything up again after work. I think fixing this would increase user engagement on your apps. For example, having my podcasts on Apple podcasts is just more convenient now because I don't need to deal with this daily inconvenience. Every week, that's multiple hours of engagement per user (for a subset of podcast listeners) that you could be gaining back.I'm a huge fan of Spotify, so I'd love to be able to seamlessly use your app over Apple Podcasts for this use case. Thanks

title: [Podcasts] Distinguish played episodes from those I haven't played but marked as played
author: demeus1985
body: Hi, I listen to many podcasts and sometimes I cannot remember if I listened a specific one. For example, sometimes I skip an episode because the title doesn't seem appealing but some time later somebody recommends it and I don't recall if I actually played it. I would like to be able to distinguish those episodes I actually played from those I haven't played but marked as played, in order to remove them from the "new episodes" list. I'm thinking about 2 options:Being able to search for specific episodes through the history of "recently played" (which hopefully contains the whole list, not only the recently played). The other options is something like what iVoox does. I see a new episode in the "new" list and I can mark it as seen but I still see I didn't play it. Thanks!

title: [Desktop][Friend Feed] Device Indicator on Friend Activity
author: kaworu_bloodpaw
body: I spend most of my day listening to Spotify, and I constantly check my Friend Activity panel to see if my friends are listening or not. I do however often wonder if they are listening on Desktop or Mobile since Friend Activity doesn't exist on mobile. I think it would be cool if a device indicator was added to the Friend Activity panel for each user, something like Discord does.Spotify currently has both the blue dot next to a user's profile picture and a waveform icon when a user is listening. I think either the dot could be replaced with a phone icon when someone is listening on mobile (like Discord), or a little desktop/mobile icon could be placed next to the existing waveform icon. @Echo_The_Cute_Wolf made a mockup for me. Something kinda like this, but obviously more in Spotify's branding/design. My imagination takes me to something similar to the Connect icon. I think this spot would be a great spot for this icon, and a great addition to Friend Activity. If possible, I would like the indicator to remain even after users stop listening to Spotify, but I would be content if it didn't. If you like my idea, please vote for it, and share it with others!Thanks! See how the Idea Exchange works here.

title: [All Platforms][Other] Romanized Lyrics for Songs Not In Latin Alphabet
author: amknana12
body: Recently, Spotify (at least in my iOS app) has added a very helpful feature which is lyrics. It finally collaborated with Musixmatch (thanks God why haven't you done this sooner). Problem is, I am an Indonesian listener who is familiar with Latin alphabet. I loved many Asian songs, which we know, are not written in language using those Latin alphabets, namely K-Pop, J-Pop, or you name it. Those songs' lyrics are still shown in their original alphabet (K-Pop in hangeul, J-Pop in kanji and hiragana, etc). Usually, foreign listeners are able to sing-a-long by looking at the romanization version. Now I know that Musixmatch indeed does not have that romanization lyrics, but Genius does and I know Spotify has partnership too with Genius, I guess? So, why not give a choice for listeners to choose between Genius or Musixmatch? TL;DR:1. We want romanized lyrics to Asian songs or any songs not using Latin alphabet2. Give options for Spotify listeners to choose which version to show3. If Spotify can no longer show Genius' service, push Musixmatch so that they make romanized lyrics available. Sincerely,Global Spotify member. [UPDATE]A comment below notified me that Musixmatch has provided options for translations and indeed they are now shown in Spotity. I see this as a nice improvement! However, what we wanted is a romanized version of the original language so we can do sing-along ðŸ˜ž Please make this happen!

title: [Podcasts] Subtitles for Podcasts
author: arebecaIuana
body: Thanks for the "karaoke" feature that allows us to follow the lyrics of the songs. It's great for anyone learning a new language or who needs to find a specific part of a song's lyrics, and especially for deaf people who, different from what is generally expected, also like to enjoy music on Spotify and this feature makes the experience more accessible.However, a similar feature has not yet been implemented in podcasts, which is a shame as there are many creators producing extremely relevant content on the platform, but, for lack of an accessibility feature, this content doesnâ€™t reach as many people as possible and many creators choose to make their content available on platforms that respect the diversity of their audience.By making some updates to the karaoke feature that already exists on the platform we can have a Spotify more accessible to everyone. The ideal is a tool that generates an automatic description of the spoken content, as present in other online platforms, but also allows edits to be made by the content creator itself.And then it should be automatically synchronized with the audio and available in the desktop and mobile version as well.This update will bring more people to Spotify, as many people consume podcast media looking to learn a new language and would like to be able to check words they don't understand well, in addition, browsing the synchronized caption of the content allows you to find which part of a particular episode has the information that the person is looking for.Most importantly, it will highlight the issue of accessibility for people with disabilities and initiate a dialogue with the disabled people community, because deficiencies are part of human diversity and must be respected.

title: [All Platforms] Change playback speed when listening to music
author: Gackolpz
body: Ok before i start i want to tell you of the history of the requests for this issue. the oldest request i can find had 573 upvotes and was a generally good idea (Link to OP). spotify's response: Hey folks. We're marking this idea as Case Closed today as it's "Not Right Now" status hasn't changed in over 3 years. We're working hard to update the ideas you're voting on that have a chance at getting built at Spotify--we're trying to be fully transparent here. Please continue to leave your feedback here in the Idea Exchange so we can bring it to our product owners, thanks! Now this response is basically saying: "since we dont have the time to implement this right now, we are going to close this case and never come back to it." Another user had the same issue i had (post here) AND HE GOT CASED CLOSED FOR TRYING TO BRING BACK THE DISCUSSION. Ok, now i think spotify should allow you to change the playback speed of tracks. Youtube has that abillity and honestly this makes me want to cancell my spotify premium plan and switch to a youtube red plan. Spotidy could even use it to get more premium users if it was a premium only feature. A lot of users like to listen to music at faster or slower speeds (especially slow orchestral music) and for us Youtube would be a better option. Thank you for listening to my rant - Gacko

title: Album Progression Tracking
author: reaganstarr95
body: When you are listening to an album you haven't played through before, the app (desktop or mobile) tracks your progression and allows you to resume where you last played. Think of it like watching through a new season of your favorite show. When you start playing episode 1 (and of course you're binge watching), after you finish with episode 6, you don't have to go back and watch bits and pieces of the previous 6 episodes in order to realize you should be starting episode 7 -- the streaming service does it for you. This same concept could apply to Spotify. If you are in the throws of discovering a new artist and you haven't learned the titles of their discography yet, but you want to absorb their work the way the artist intended (by listening to the album all the way through), this would be a huge asset!

title: [All Platforms][Connect] re-categorise podcasts as AUDIO so they play on Connect devices
author: itsmrjack
body: Podcasts will not play on audio-only Connect devices because Spotify has labelled them as "mixed-media". They are not mixed media, they are audio files. This is an issue that has been noted by the community for some time (around 18 months at least) and not addressed by Spotify in any serious way. It is not a niche problem as it will affect ALL users who listen to podcasts and own an audio-only Spotify Connect device. In other words, potentially millions of people globally. Please Spotify, rectify this issue as a matter of urgency. I for one am a regular podcast listener who bought an audio-only Connect device so that I could play podcasts through it, only to find that I cannot because of a categorisation error on your part. To further elucidate the issue, and Spotify's lack of action on it, I point to an earlier (now closed) idea post submitted by another user (charango88) https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/All-Platforms-Connect-Make-Podcasts-playable-on-audio-... The advice given to this Spotify user was that this is "an issue that's worth investigating" and for them to find relevant help topics. However no relevant help topics exist for this problem.

title: Customer controlled payment dates
author: MoreControl
body: Hello Because Iâ€™ve given you my Debit card number, I canâ€™t control when you seek the payment from my current account, which is set on the day I signed up. As this is not at the beginning of the month, it results intermittently in failed payments. I propose allowing customers to set up payments by a fixed mandate (Standing Order), on the same day every month, where customers know there will be funds in the account. I understand the solution, according to your customer support, is to cancel my current plan, wait until my account reverts to the Free tier, then simply resubscribe to Premium on my preferred billing date. With 5 individuals using the account, this is clunky in the extreme. Help people take control of their finances in the same way you propose taking the friction out of entertainment. Thanks in advanceFergal

title: [Privacy] Private Session should stay active
author: jakenfinn
body: Let's face it. We've all used Spotify to listen to music that we would be embarassed to advertise publically. Whether it's kittens meowing Christmas songs, that your friends would never let you live down, or a hardcore rap album, that you wouldn't want your 8 year old cousin to go and listen to because his cool aunt or uncle likes it. When it comes to this social music app, privacy is not a convenient bonus feature, it's a critical necessity. Currently, the only way to listen to songs privately on Spotify, is to go to the settings and activate a private session. This is not only annoying, since I constantly have to navigate through settings to activate privacy on my phone, it's stressful because you have to worry about whether or not certain people can see what you're listening too. My primary music app should not cause anxiety about what I share publically. From a 2011 blog post "Spotify is all about sharing and discovering new music. Itâ€™s entirely up to you what you decide to share and what you keep private." With the first part in mind, it makes sense that spotify would default to making all of the music you listen to public to your followers but the second part is not true. Anyone can follow me on Spotify and if I have to continuously activate a private session, there will inevitably be times when I forget. As a paying customer, I should have the ability to hide what I listen to if I please and activate privacy indefinitely.

title: [Social] CURIOUS TO HEAR WHAT PERSON NEXT TO YOU LISTENING TO? Music Sharing
author: Crossbnz
body: Hello,Just imagine a situation:You are sitting in the bus. And listening to your favourite music on headphones. When you notice a cute person who is sitting in the bus too, and really enjoying the music, while shaking head with the beat. So curious.. WHAT SHE/HE IS LISTENING TO?!How to know that? You take your phone from your pocket and open spotify app. There you see everyperson in 50m radius who is using Spotify and shares their music. And you see that she is listening for A-HA - TAKE ON MEE!. You connect to her music and listen to this song also. And when the bus stops, you leave it and say to her/him: ARE YOU PLANNING TO GO TO A-HA CONCERT THIS SUMMER? I LOVE THIS SONG TOO.And you live happily ever after â¤ï¸THE END (Or maybe just a beginning ðŸ™‚___So, the thing is : a possibility to look for surrounding spotify users and see what they are listening. A possibility to connect to their song. A possibility to turn ON or turn OFF music sharing (maybe you would like a private moment, and dont want to see everyone listening for your "shame songs" haha!I personally really really often pass a person with headphones and am very very curious, what they are listening to that moment.LIKE THIS IDEA? PLEASE VOTE UP AND LETS CREATE EVEN BETTER, CONNECTED SPOTIFY COMMUNITY Cheers,Arturas from Lithuania

title: [Mobile] Preview albums for free users
author: ollylee03
body: Recently, Spotify took away the ability for free users to see what songs are in an album or by a particular artist. Before, free users were able to select an album, press â€œpreviewâ€ or â€œand moreâ€, and see a list of all the songs in the album, each with a short audio demo. This made it much easier to discover new artists, and created a much more convenient user experience. The only way to hear samples of songs now is to listen through Spotify-made playlists. Unfortunately lots of smaller artists don't feature on many of these playlists making it very difficult to sample/discover their music. Obviously, I understand that as a free user there are compromises that need to be made by users like listening to ads, only being able to shuffle and not being able to listen to specific songs, but removing the ability to see what songs I'm shuffling is silly; so silly in fact that many users thought it was a glitch in the app at first. It's clear that this is an attempt to force more free users into going premium but some users simply can't afford it, so this is an unnecessary punishment. Many users, including myself, will be looking for alternative music services if this change isn't reversed.

title: [Desktop][Friend Feed] Move 'Share Activity' Toggle to Friend Activity
author: LouisDavis
body: Spotify recently decided to change the default of whether a user is sharing their activty or not. This update doesn't actually solve the issue that the activity toggle is hard to find and unknown by a large majority of users. My suggestion is to place a toggle and indicator at the top of the 'Friend Activty' sidebar so that users can turn on and off their activty sharing with ease and be aware of their sharing status. This will not totally resolve the issue because a user will need to have the 'Friend Activity' sidebar enabled to see it to start with but it is a start to making this functionality far more accessible and obvious. An additional change would be to place a 'Share Activty with Friends' button under the 'Private Session' button in the profile dropdown menu with a green check mark to it when enabled similar to what the 'Private Session' button does when enabled. If this is done it is important to make it clear in the settings menu and possibly through hints what the difference is between enabling a private session, and disabling sharing your activity.

title: [Discover] Find similar Playlists to your own Playlist
author: Ptomalley35
body: I have a playlist of all of my favorite songs. Just from browsing around Spotify for a little I found a playlist that had about 70% of the songs in my playlist in it. I soon discovered that I loved the majority of the songs in this new playlist that I didn't already have in mine. I have discovered a lot of new music this way, but it is difficult and time consuming to find new playlist similar to mine. I think it would be awesome to have the ability to discover new playlist that contain a lot of the same songs as my own playlist. This could be done with a "Search for Similar Playlists" feature that allows users to drag multiple songs or playlist into a search feature that locates playlists others have created that have a high percentage of similar songs in it.

title: Spotify & "Song Radio" is Essentially Just an Echo Chamber & Doesn't Breed Discovery
author: cawul
body: This hasn't always been the case, and I don't know if this has to do with the amount of time I've had my Spotify account or if something about the algorithm has drastically changed - but whenever I start a radio based off a song or artist (which is with the intention to find a NEW artist or NEW music that is related to the song/artist I'm starting the radio off of) it just creates essentially a playlist of music I've been listening to - and not even within the same genre off the song. I've realized that I haven't found any new artists or any new music, and just continuously listen to the same things over and over again which is quite depressing. The point of the song radio or at least how I use it is to discover new artists that are in the same realm of the artist I'm listening to, and I think you all at Spotify are putting everyone - artist AND listener - at a huge detrimental disadvantage by having it go that way because then there is no discovery for new artists and there is no way for listeners to get into new music without scouring the platform instead of giving good recommendations based off your algorithm. More than anything I want to be able to discover new artists based off song radio, not just hear the same songs I've been listening to. If I wanted to listen to those songs, I would just continue to listen to them. Especially since maybe when I start a song radio off something that is midwest-emo/indie, it'll still play hyperpop/rap in the same playlist which are two completely different genre's and moods.

body: Hi!Whenever I jump ahead in the queue and select a later song, it clears my whole queue, a feature that I don't like considering the "Clear queue" button. I then have to remember and requeue songs. I would prefer if selecting a song would play it not, but not clear all things prior in my queue. Thank you!

title: [Playlists] Resume for Music & Podcast
author: francovdw
body: Spotify no longer provide one media type (Music)By adding Podcasts it now offers two media types (Music & Podcasts) Each of these media types gets used in different ways during the day & week. Having a RESUME button to continue each of these media types independently will be helpfull. The Example:- While working from home you might listen to a podcast.- Then maybe you need to drive somewhere quickly, you might want to listen to some music- Once back home you want to continue with your podcast The Frustration:- You can not continue your music when in the car because the podcast is queued to resume- You can not continue your podcast because the music is queued to resume The Idea:RESUME BUTTON- MUSICor- PODCAST

title: [Mobile] Option to customize Your Daily Drive
author: caffdawg
body: Just got a playlist called "Your Daily Drive". So far, it's great because it mixes in news-like podcast snippets inbetween suggested songs. However, it'd be great to mark a podcast as 'do not play again' or 'dislike' so it doesn't show up or similar podcasts don't appear. It would also like to love/like songs that appear, as well as the ability to complete skip a podcast if its something I'm less interested in. Podcast runs similar to normal podcast, but I feel that this is a different experience (and a catered one), we should have more freedom to skip/like/love/dislike to make this experience improve over time. Thank you!

title: [Control4][Partnership] Control4 Native Integration
author: ShoreSoundCinema
body: I am writing this post to request that Spotify allow native integration from control platforms such as Control4, Savant, Creston and Josh.ai without the needs of our clients to use Spotify Connect. To the best of my knowledge, Sonos is the only 3rd party vendor to have direct access to the API from within their platform. With platforms such as Control4, the end user has too many steps and potential points of failure, prior to achieving a successful Spotify stream. Our clients in the CI (custom integration) market space, are high net worth individuals, that typically own more than one home. Spotify connect is a terrible way to bring your product to our client base. We are a Control4 dealer and we have native integration to Pandora, Sirius/XM, Tidal, Deezer, Qobuz and more. We defer to these streaming services over Spotify for ease of use and the client does not want to go through all of the additional steps and leave the Control4 App to manage their Spotify service. It is about time that Spotify allows direct access to their services direct from the above referenced Control Platforms. Thank you for your time and consideration.

We've marked this as 'New Suggestion'.Spotify Staff will look into this idea once it reaches the necessary amount of votes.More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.

title: [Mobile] See all Songs on Artist Page
author: TLuck
body: Dear spotify, First of all, thanks for your awesome service! I really enjoy my premium account on my desktop and iPhone version and use it at home and wherever I go. However there's something that bothers me often while searching for a song, especially on the iPhone version. I often search for a song of a specific artist. So I use the search function and reach the artist's page. Once there, the app only shows the 5 most popular songs of the artist. But often the song I'm looking for is not listed there (maybe nr 6 on the list or lower). Now I have the option of searching through the albums, which can be quite time consuming, or try to use the search function again and hope to find it with a more specific combination of words (provided that I know anything more than the artist's name). Now every time I get to this I'm thinking why can't I tap a button ('see all songs') which allows me to see all the artist's songs in a list? That is something I'm looking for intuitively. On the desktop version, the list of 5 can be extended to 10 most popular, but also here I'm thinking: why only 10?! Actually, the list I'm looking for can be brought up by the app already by playing the first song (while not in shuffle mode) and tapping the playlist icon. This brings up the kind of list I would like to see: all the artists songs I can just browse through. Only now I'm playing the first song, which I didn't want to hear at all. Preferably, I would want to be albe to sort the list in order of popularity or alphabet. Cheers!
status_message: Updated on 2020-06-09Hey,We appreciate you coming to the Community, and adding your votes and comments to this idea.We're keeping this idea marked as 'Not Right Now', as this isn't something we have any immediate plans to implement.If we do have any new info to share, rest assured we'll check back in here with a new status.Thanks!

title: [Mobile] Add setting to stop videos in app from autoplaying
author: lizzys17
body: Give the user the ability to turn off autoplay videos. You gave us the ability to turn off the Canvas music videos, but now autoplaying videos are infiltrating other places on the app, like album covers. (see picture below) There is a play button indicating that it is a video, but it just starts automatically playing without me pressing the play button. I would like for this "feature" to stop. A lot of users can not have constant motion as it is overstimulating and those users should not be forced to endure the videos without having control over it.Please give us an option in the settings to have these videos NOT auto-play!

title: [iOS][Other] Expand equalizer controls
author: HDVIDTECH
body: Add an advanced eq for more precise tuning. This would work best as a parametric eq. Digital mixers like AVID, Soundcraft, Midas and more have precise control through graphical EQ to boost/cut specific frequencies. This way if I wanted to boost 40 Hz I could drill down to it specifically. Great for leveling out a system highs and lows.

title: [Mobile][Browse] Reset playing next from
author: zardox
body: Currently, in the panel "Playing from play queue" displays the heading "Now playing." In addition, if there are any selections queued there is a listing titled "Next in Queue" with one option "Clear Queue".Below the queue is a listing of songs under the heading "Next from..."My request - Add an additional button next to the heading "Next from..." labeled "Reset". Pressing this "reset" button:- removes all songs from the "Next from" listing- terminates any autoloading of songs to next from. Even if the settings have Autoplay selected as active.The above queue would remain. One would also need to press "Clear Queue" In other words, all processes that select songs to play are stopped. Only what has been queued remains It may be necessary to have a confirmation dialog to appear after reset is pressed.I need this because my mood shifts to mellow I don't want jamming songs pop up just because earlier I was in the mood to dance. And vice versa. And many times I want only the queue to be played then the app is silent.

title: [Playlists] Adding custom voice commentary in-between songs
author: Mickos8
body: I am currently creating a "top 100" playlist for an upcoming party. The idea is that it would mimic a radio countdown and ideally there would be an option in Spotify to add song number "call outs" so that listeners could follow along with what number in the countdown we are up to (and what number songs are coming in at). I see this working as potentially pre-recorded call outs simply saying along the lines of "number 47", "number one" etc. The user could decide which songs to have the pre-fix call out in the list, or potentially all songs in the list, to help follow along for any countdown style playlists people are creating. his is a great feature for parties for people creating lists similar to myself or recreating top 40, or billboard top lists from a bygone era to replay.

title: [Desktop][Playlists] Playlist image: option to set permanent image even if song order changes later
author: aurantiumdulcis
body: Hey! So, as you know, the cover of the 4 first albums in a playlist become its default image, or we have an option to upload an image of our own. If you change the first 4 songs, the image changes accordingly. In playlists where the song order doesn't matter, of course you place first the 4 albums you want featured in the image. But sometimes you have a playlist (like a playlist for a decade or a particular time period of your life) where you want the songs to be listed in chronological order starting with the first years. In these cases, maybe the first 4 songs are not representative of most of the playlist, so they do not give other users a good idea of it. So maybe we could have an option to place first the 4 songs whose albums we want in the image as usual, then set that image as permanent and after that sort the songs however we like without the image changing. It would be great and could help better portray the contents of a chronological playlist ðŸ™‚

title: [Your Library] Multiple profiles per person
author: MissPTT
body: At work? Jump into your work persona and playlists.Travelling? Set the app to your travel profile and continue the podcast you were listening to earlier.At home? Change to your home profile and browse through your lounge playlists with relevant recommendations.Netflix and chill? Switch to your romancing profile and play an enhanced playlist safe in the knowledge no Enya, Rick Astley or Hamilton tunes will show up. I very strongly believe there should be the option to have different profiles or user areas for different 'moods' a single person might be in during the day and that they shouldn't mix. The user I am at work is not the same user I am at the gym. What I want to listen to is completely different.PLUS, the option to exclude certain profiles from your wrapped data. I don't want 'Focus music for work' to be my most listened to playlist (even if technically it is). xx

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Preference settings for suggested songs
author: whitefuzzy
body: TLDR: algorithm for enhance to offer more precise music I really enjoy the enhance feature, however when creating some playlist, I'm not looking for similar genre or "sound." Would it be possible for an option for when creating a playlist, someone can pick the intent/motivation of the playlist? Example: genre, sound/grove/vibe, lyrics/feel, etc. This way an algorithm can seek songs not only matching the uses taste, but the feel/mood they are going for with that playlist. Often I am trying to go for a certain feel or mood with a playlist and an artist may have a song that is perfect, but their others / other artist like them, are not. So what happens is I get slammed with suggestions which don't help (even if I like the song).

title: [All Platforms][Your Library] Double Like; Favourite Songs
author: Anselme
body: Hi, among your favorite songs there are always songs which are the "favorites among the favorites". Why not introduce an extra icon or symbol/button here, so that you can highlight the titles among your favourite songs and these will then be played preferentially. I currently have 533 favourite songs, but I notice that I often scroll through the list to really listen to the songs that I particularly like. If I could mark these and there was a command: Play Super Favourite Songs, then Spotify would automatically play these "extra favourite songs" among the already selected favourite songs without me having to search for them manually. You could also call them the "double favourite songs" or the "Double heart songs".

title: [Android][Your Library] local files sorted within folders as they appear in the local storage
author: chagitniss
body: Hi, first of all I really like the Spotify app. Thank you very much for it.Secondly, before I had Spotify, I used to create folders on my phone (named "Winter 2020", "Summer 2022", etc.) that contained the song files I heard at that time, so this days I have many playlists (= folders) which literally contain the playlists of my life... With Spotify, I was happy to discover that you can listen to files in the device's local storage, but I was disappointed when I realized that the songs are arranged in one long list sorted alphabetically, and not sorted by the folders I have in the local storage. It would be very nice if there will be an option to have the "local files" in Spotify sorted by the folders in the local storage, or even to get the local folders as playlists in my Spotify library, so I could rename the playlists and add an image (as I can do with regular playlists today). Thank you very much!!!

title: [Playlists] Change Playlists Without Interrupting Music
author: aidenthesnyder
body: It is a feature that would allow the user to change from one playlist to another without abruptly ending the song currently playing. Essentially the user is able to queue up a playlist that will take over more seamlessly than just jumping straight into it. This would be different from the current playlist queueing option because the user will be moving between playlists as opposed to simply queueing every song in a playlist. It would be good for maintaining the flow of songs and would also allow for being able to shuffle a queued playlist. The feature would be optional to the user and adjustable in the settings menu based on personal preference.

title: [Discover] New Releases Section for Followed Artists
author: MattSuda
body: Please add a section to the desktop and mobile apps where we can see all of the new releases from the artists we follow. When artists release new music, their fans want a way to find it directly in Spotify without having to rely on social media or elsewhere away from the Spotify app. The Release Radar playlist by Spotify only shows some new releases and then it disappears a week later. This new section would act as a "feed" and update automatically when a new album from an artist you follow is available on Spotify. Please make the feed have a high display limit so we can go back months and months and for sure won't miss any releases. For a third party solution check out (PLEASE IMPLEMENT IT LIKE THIS) https://spotifyreleaselist.netlify.app ---> Check out my guide on how to use this third party web app Screenshot from https://spotifyreleaselist.netlify.app: The problem with the current "new releases" section is that it doesn't show new releases from artists you follow. It only show the most popular new releases. The only way right now to find new releases is to go to the artist's page and hunt around for the new release or use the Release Radar playlist. The Release Radar playlist is not what we want. The problem with the Release Radar playlist is that it mixes in suggestions. I want to see followed artists ONLY. And if you check the playlist a week too late, all the songs are GONE. We need a feed that we can scroll back months and months and months so we can see all the new releases from the artists we follow. We shouldn't have to rush through it and it be gone the next week.

title: Managing Duplicates Of Releases
author: Jua-537s
body: The result of a re-upload of an album, an EP, a single, or a collection can sometimes cause there to be duplicates of the same release. while sometimes the difference is the inclusion/exclusion of singles in an album or a collection, in most cases it is the exact same release down to the waveform. This leads to a few problems. 1- Users unknowingly saving the same songs or albums more than once.2- Being unable to find a specific release when looking for it.Options For Fixes 1:It has been mentioned on a separate thread that newly uploaded releases should be overriding old releases, and when going into an older one the URL should redirect to the newer upload of that same release. While in most cases that does seem to be the case, sometimes that doesn't work. Perhaps the uploader (artist) is doing something incorrectly, in which case they need to be educated and explained this. 2:I think the best option to keep track of different releases is having an identifier- just like every other medium has a specific identifier, whether an LP, a CD, a cassette, or anything else; every single pressing and master has a unique ID. Spotify doesn't keep track of albums this way. I think it would make a lot of sense to have an ID value for each unique release available on Spotify. Another option is having the ability to search using URLs. With each release having a unique URL this can act similarly to having an ID. EXAMPLES: In Between Dreams by Jack Johnson- While not a duplicate, one of the versions has an extra track- "Constellations - Demo Version". This is the most easily accessed one when searching. The other release has the same tracks but does not feature the extra track. Brothers In Arms by Dire Straits- There are 2 identical versions of this that I'm aware of. Soul Mining by The The- This is a great example of how it should be, having a dropdown menu at the bottom (PC app) and the ability to select each of the 4 releases. This particular example is more obvious since it has different covers in different counties.* It should be noted that the only way I am able to find these different releases is that I saved them before they became harder to find.

title: [Community][Social] Recommending songs to friends through the app
author: pygs
body: My friends and I often recommend each other songs from Spotify. I think it would be quite handy to have a specific feature on the app for this purpose. This could be done by either adding a sort of direct message feature for sending a song to a certain user or by adding a recommended songs playlist feature*. *Add a "recommend to user" feature, that would work sort of like the "add to playlist" button. When hovering over the "recommend to user" button, it would display a list of your friends on Spotify (people who you follow, who follow u back). Clicking the name of a friend would then add the song to a "recommended by your friends" playlist in the "for you" section, that would only be visible to said user. The recommended songs could disappear after a certain amount of time, or after the user has discarded them.

title: [Your Library] AI create a mashup
author: RohitShelar
body: As you may know, the music streaming market is highly competitive, with many platforms vying for a share of the market. To stay ahead of the competition, I would like to suggest that Spotify consider using AI to offer a unique and differentiated feature that would set you apart from other music streaming platforms.Specifically, I suggest that Spotify explore the possibility of offering a mashup feature that uses AI to automatically generate unique and creative remixes of songs. This feature could allow users to select two or more songs and have the AI create a mashup that combines elements of each track to create a new and exciting remix.I believe that this feature would be highly appealing to users who are looking for a new and innovative way to experience music. It would also give Spotify a competitive edge over other platforms that do not offer a similar feature.

title: [Social] Rooms/Shared Listening Concept
author: marcdreizehn
body: Hello there! I know this idea has been brought up before, but all those ideas were several years ago by now, and I couldn't find a recent discussion about this. Imagine having "rooms" within Spotify, where you can listen together, simultaneously, to the same track with everybody else in the room, no matter where in the world they are, and no matter what device they're using. You can step up and join the DJ queue, and all DJs in the room play one track, one after another. The friend feed on the right side turns into a chatbox, and you can communicate and talk about music while listening to the same tracks. Think tuntable.fm, plug.dj, jqbx.fm, ... but right inside Spotify! Check out this Medium article by Austin Condiff I found today, detailing this concept (following mockup taken from that article). I've been hoping to have some social aspect like this within Spotify, and I think this would enrich the community even further. You could create rooms based on genres or moods, and enjoy music together with friends and strangers alike. An upvote/downvote function would keep rooms democratic and true to their respective themes. The mentioned article perfectly explains the concept and benefits of this feature, please check it out! Thoughts? Thanks and have a great day!
status_message: Updated on 2020-10-15Hi everyone! Thanks for coming to the Community, and adding your votes to this idea. We're setting this to 'not right now' as we don't currently have any plans to implement this.In the meantime, we do however now have the option to join a remote Group Session with all your friends and enjoy the same tracks simultaneously no matter how many miles apart you might be. For more information be sure to check out our Support site page. If we have any more info to share on this, rest assured we'll check back in here.Thanks!

title: [Other] Location-based music suggestions
author: GoodIdeasMan
body: Dear Spotify Feedback Team,I am writing to share an exciting idea for a new feature that could revolutionize the way users experience music on your platform. The idea is to introduce location-based music suggestions, which would allow users to enjoy customized music experiences that reflect their current location and environment.The location-based music suggestions feature would use geolocation data to detect the user's location and suggest playlists or tracks that are tailored to the environment. For example, if the user is at the beach, Spotify could suggest playlists with beach-themed music, while if the user is in a forest, Spotify could suggest playlists with more relaxing or natural sounds. The music would change dynamically based on the user's location, seamlessly transitioning from one playlist to another as the user moves from one environment to another.The feature could also include curated musical regions, which would showcase the unique musical cultures of different regions and locations. These curated playlists could be created in collaboration with local artists, music historians, or tourism boards, and would allow users to discover new music and cultural experiences that are specific to each location.We believe that the location-based music suggestions feature would be a great addition to the Spotify platform, providing users with a personalized and engaging music experience that is tailored to their current location and environment. This feature could be particularly useful for travelers or those exploring new regions, but could also be a great way for anyone to discover new music experiences that are unique to their local area.Thank you for considering this idea. We believe that it has great potential to enhance the user experience on the Spotify platform and we look forward to seeing it come to life.

title: [Playlists] Smart Playlists (Nested)
author: SuperSpasm
body: A smart playlist consists of other playlists, as one big joined playlist - it can be played in sequence or shuffled. I believe this could be a game changer for the Spotify (playlist) eco-system. ImplementationIn playlist creation, allow the user to add "sub" playlistsAlso let them add other smart playlistsPlaylists can be shared/reused in multiple smart playlistsRegular songs can still be added alongside playlists. NOTE: This is not accomplished by playlist folders! See below. Benefits over playlist foldersPlaylist Reuse: Any number of smart playlists can share a playlist! whereas only one folder can contain a the same playlist.This will allow having smaller, "atomic" playlists as building blocks of larger ones.Example: Below "Oldies" is shared / reused by different smart playlists:Easy morning [smart] = (Oldies -> Chill) Nostalgia [smart] = (Oldies -> 90's -> Specific songs)Sharing (A) - This could encourage playlist creators to make more nuanced playlists, as they will have a tool to compose more of them out of parts, instead of investing in a single large one, or copy-pasting like crazy.Sharing (B) - This could also open up an entire new content eco-system for compiling other creator's playlists, and re-sharing them as a new whole.Easy "temp" playlists - Currently, to combinine playlists for a party, drive, etc- you must break your organizational hierarchy to create a folder.This causes a mess to be cleaned later.Having a single "temp" smart playlist would allow you to change it's contents on the fly, without messing up your playlist organization.I have more ideas, but I'll add them as a reply so this is more readable ðŸ™‚ I realize this is not a small feature - but for a few years I've felt It's absence, and I really believe this could be a game changer - if done properly. Happy to hear any thoughts! ðŸ™‚

title: [Mobile][Other] Volume Intervals
author: colecody27
body: Idea This idea would implement functionality to assist with workouts or other tasks that require keeping track of time intervals. This would allow the user to create one or more intervals that alternate the volume between high and low after a specified period of time. Both volumes and durations will be set by the user. This would prevent the user from having to utilize an additional application that uses an obnoxious noise which could break user concentration or interrupt the flow of music, or continuously referencing a clock or timer. This functionality not only assist with the time intervals but would also provide users with an increase in volume when they are in need of "extra motivation" for instance. For example: Take for instance, running intervals on a treadmill. This user wants to run for 1 minute and walk for 2 minutes for a total of 30 minutes. The user would create an interval with a "high" and "low" volume. Let's say low is set to 25%, high is set to 50%. The user would then input the duration for both volumes which in this case will be: low set to 2 minutes, high set to 1 minutes. Once the user begins their music, this interval will begin, alternating between the two defined volumes notifying the user when to walk and run until the end of the 30 minutes.

title: Exclude Audiobooks from Spotify Wrapped Album Charts
author: kikibeh
body: Currently in every years Spotify Wrapped audiobooks the user listens to throughout the year are included into the album/artist charts which sum up who you listened most to and which album. However, this always messes up my stats because often times one audiobook will pop up, In my opinion, audiobooks should not be included there, becuase this is not music. Clearly if you will listen to a whole audiobooks its time consuming and therefore most definitley exceed your real music stats. This is sad and always cracks me up at the end of the year because I will never truly know which artist/album truly would have taken the audiobooks place...I, therefore, suggets to either exclude audiobooks (through their category) fully from spotify wrapped or do an additional wrapped page only for audiobooks like the podcasts one. I hope I am not the only one bothered about this, and maybe spotify will be able to fix this by the end of this year. I would be really happy ðŸ™‚

title: [iOS] Allow users to turn off Auto-repeat for car bluetooth
author: derekontherocks
body: Hello! I originally thought this was an issue with Autoplay, but after some testing it appears to be unrelated. When connecting to vehicle bluetooth, Spotify automatically turns on repeat for whatever I'm listening to (album or playlist). This is not how I want Spotify to behave, but there's no setting that allows me to change this behavior; I therefore have to manually turn repeat off, even though I'm not turning repeat on in the first place. In addition, this behavior persists when I disconnect from my car, meaning repeat automatically turning on affects my out-of-car listening experience as well.

title: [Podcasts] Split out podcasts into separate app
author: pwilczynski
body: There have been many posts about improving the UI for podcasts within the Spotify app. But the more reasonable architectural decision seems to be to use a separate app for podcasts / audiobooks. Trying to cram too much into the spotify music app is confusing; it bloats the experience and distracts the user. As an episodic medium with repeat consumption and curation, podcasts are just very different than traditional music. In particular, once I've decided to listen to a podcast, the likelihood of me wanting to listen to music is extremely low - podcast-specific search, prioritization and discovery is much worse when mixed up with musical content.

title: [Amazon Alexa] Swap Spotify accounts without changing Alexa account
author: rowets
body: I have a Spotify Family account for myself and my wife I have an alexa unit in every room, every unit is using MY amazon account as all the lights and home automation can only be setup on one Amazon account I want to play Spotify in the room iâ€™m in My wife wants to play her music in a different room Both myself and my wife also want to use the home automation whilst playing music, eg, turning on the lights This can be done using Apple music and Amazon music but Spotify require to swap to a different spotify account for the other person To swap to a different spotify account means changing the Alexa profile of the alexa device and then all the home automation no longer works from that device. Please can you allow both myself and my wife to play music in different rooms WITHOUT having to change the Amazon Alexa account It would be great if I could say â€˜Alexa, play spotify from Trevors accountâ€™ and my wife could say in a different room, at the same time, â€˜Alexa, play spotify from Jackieâ€™s accountâ€™ This is not a duplicate of other suggestions, Iâ€™ve checked and anything close was raised before the ability to swap alexa accounts was implemented. Swapping alexa accounts is only a work around and is not a solution to this problem. Many people want this feature and your chat team said I should raise it here Here is a link to the forum, lots of people are leaving spotify because only spotify do not support this feature, you guys need to catch up https://community.spotify.com/t5/Premium-for-Family/FAMILY-AND-ECHO-ALEXA/m-p/4900618#M26242 From my research it seems there is talk about Spotify only has one concurrent music stream whereas Apple and Amazon music have multiple streams, but please can you improve on this, the thread above was started over 18 months ago, something should be done to improve on this issue Again, please donâ€™t write this off as a duplicate and do nothing/say it relates to a 3rd party, people still want this feature Thanks Trevor Rowe 19/2/2021 Folks, just a quick update on this. Spotify say this The Community team talks with various other Spotify teams several times a month about ideas with over 500 votes (our criteria for being a top idea). Itâ€™s from these meetings that we apply one of the following statuses to each ideaâ€¦. This idea has reached over 500 votes so I asked on chat for timescales/what will happen next and was told to keep an eye on this thread. That really sounded open ended! As the person on chat could only deal with app and account queries, I was told to also contact the support team to get action on this So as well as voting for this issue (please continue), Spotify need to keep up with Apple and Amazon and fix this issue - with your help we might just get this solved!

title: [Desktop] Don't go to sleep when playing audio
author: dtki7
body: I don't know about Windows, but on Linux the host will go to sleep while playing music. Most media players do not share this behavior. I suggest to add a call to `gtk_application_inhibit` and `gtk_application_uninhibit` in a "playback status change" callback (e.g. https://github.com/GNOME/rhythmbox/blob/56a31de234440f2813228a5bceac174758a5677e/plugins/power-manag...). Thank you very much.
