title: [Your Library] Album reminder messages Google Photos style
author: Digimuziek
body: Are you tired of adding an album to your collection, only to forget about it a few weeks later? Just like with photos on you mobile phone. I propose that Spotify adds reminder messages for albums in your collection, just like the ones you receive in Google Photos. These "Play it Again" reminders could maybe come in the form of messages from the artist. it would strengthen the connection between fans and artists on the platform.Imagine receiving a message from your favorite artist, reminding you of an album you added to your collection months ago. This kind of personal connection is what music is all about, and it's what we're trying to bring to Spotify.If you agree that reminder messages for albums would improve the fan-artist connection on Spotify, please give this post a Like. Together, we can create a platform that truly puts fans first and helps us all stay connected to the music we love.

title: [Mobile][Browse] Multiple playback queues
author: jtjr
body: With Spotifyâ€™s push into podcasts I am routinely switching between music and podcasts. This means constantly losing my place in a given playlist or having to navigate back to podcast episode I was mid way through. Having the option to have multiple players, with their own queue and controls would eliminate this back and forth problem. Idea: long pressing a song, album or podcast should allow the user to â€œopen in new player+â€. This would pause the current player and begin playing the selected media in a seperate player. The user would now see two seperate players at the bottom of the screen. Anything the user queues will be added to the top player (which is the currently playing or last played). User can switch the play order by dragging the player position to the top or close a player by swiping to delete (basic iOS list functionality).

title: [All Platforms][Search] Search Filter for (Spotify Music & My Library)
author: Lovefire
body: INTRO:I truly believe this idea is essential to Spotify Service and User Experinence. As some who frequently will search for a specifc title of a song and find the best song in the search results with that title Spotify lists the top 1000 songs ... and 90% of all met search are clutter with rap garbage. pushing out all the potential great songs I never get to listen to. bc they didn't make it in the top 1000. IDEA:I have designed a, Spotify Search Filter, that will let you set parameter for your search when searching for music, you can also turn on the "playlist" switch and it will only search through your playlists to find a song (helps you see if you already have it and also will show you how many playlists have that song!), there are also other very helpful search parameters. See the attached photos for more details on the idea. Show your support with some likes and because likes are not enough to make an idea happen. title: [Browse] Users can save a list of live events found on Spotify
author: novasaint
body: Currently, there's a way for users to view live events happening in a particular area. It helps users discover whether their favourite artist is playing in town and easily keep track of the shows. It would be nice to have the ability to bookmark/save events users are interested in. Like the "Your Episodes" tab on the sidebar, they could be shown back to the users in a list form. Thank you for taking the time to build the awesome app, and making music accessible to all!

title: [Amazon Echo] Play multiple Speakers at the same Time
author: xoundbox
body: I recently got six(6) of the 2nd gen Amazon Echo Dots and placed them everywhere in my home. And I realized the policy of Spotify that is limiting to only one device to play music at the same time bothers me a lot when I set Spotify as a default music libary. For example, if one of my family members asks one of Echo Dots in his/her room to play music A, then music B on another Echo Dot I'm listening to stops playing. I know there is Spotify Family Plan but my kids can't join that because they are just young and they don't have any email account yet. And also I don't want to create an account for them yet. I believe Spotify could make possible to play the same music over multiple Echo Dots under the same network at the same time somehow even while it's not possible to play music on other multiple devices. Maybe by verifying some factors like if it's for Amazon Echo Dots under the same network under the same account.

title: [Social] Share 'Top artists and songs this month' on public profile.
author: Ivr
body: I appreciate that Spotify cares about my privacy and doesn't divulge my listening behaviour without my consent. But, it would be fun if we could. Of course this information is private, and should be private by default. But I would love it if there was an option that allows me to show my monthly top artists and top tracks on my profile for everyone to see, or for just my friends to see. The current option: Is fairly limited. It only shows the absolute recent artists. It doesn't show the monthly top listening charts, which would be way more fun.I get that for some people this can be sensitive information. Especially podcast content. That's why this option should probably come with a clear warning about what making this information public. But other than that. It seems like a great way to share in music tastes, see what my friends like and start conversations about it. It would make Spotify a more social experience for those who chose to be more open about their music taste.

title: [Android Auto] Show featured artists on the Now Playing screen in Android Auto
author: GrevenRache
body: When playing songs on Android Auto, only the primary artist is displayed. You have to back out to the album/playlist to see any featured artists, which is especially frustrating when listening to curated playlists that introduce new content (e.g. Discover Weekly and Release Radar). Automotive apps in particular should give as much relevant information as possible with the least possible interaction to reduce distraction while driving. Attached are photos of: the Android app showing all artists; the Android Auto app showing only the primary artist on the Now Playing screen; and the Android Auto app showing all artists on the album screen.

title: [Your Library] Bring back 'hold to preview song' button
author: rossmillen21
body: A few years ago Spotify had a feature that allowed you to hold down on a song and it would give a 10-15 second sample of the song. I used to discover so many new/different artists as it gave me a chance to preview a song before committing to listening to the full thing. It was later removed (I think in 2016?) and I enquired at the time and they said it was so they could implement another feature in the app using the hold down feature. We're in 2021 now, five years later and no such feature has been introduced. Can we please have the hold to preview feature back? It was such a good niche feature, and it gave a one up on apple music.

title: [All Platforms][Discover] Setting to prefer original (explicit) content over clean alternatives
author: muldrr
body: IssueWhile listening to music, especially when listening to through Autoplay after an album, through Discover, Daily Mixes or automatically generated playlists, Spotify often plays the "clean" edits of songs that have their original version tagged as explicit.The option "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" is there for people who don't want explicit content, but the behavior of this option is not ideal for people who have it enabled.If an explicit version of a song exists, I do not want to hear the censored, chopped up version with often mangled lyrics. I want to hear the original song as the artist intended it. In my opinion the clean version is nearly always inferior to the original.Currently it seems like the use-case of people who want to hide explicit music is valued higher than the use-case for people who want to listen to the original. I would argue that we should be treated at least equally. ExampleWhat got me here today was while listening to "Ten thousand hours" by Macklemore & Ryan Lewis, and hearing "Make sure the soundman doesn't block-block the drums" and hearing frequent "Shht"'s really breaks the flow of the track.What especially triggered me, is that it showed that I had "hearted"/liked the song. I did like the original version, and it occurs in multiple playlists of mine. The clean version does not.Note that this is not a complaint about this song in particular, it is just an example that occurred today. Proposed solutionIf the "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" option is ticked, the "clean" content is very likely of no value to the user, and should never be favored over the original version.If you do not want to force this behavior to the entire userbase, or change existing behavior for existing users, then an option could be to add an extra opt-in setting to "Block playback of clean edits when original is available" or something similar. So basically the exact opposite of the currently already implemented "Allow playback of explicit-rated content" is desired: never allow clean edits.Your team might well come up with a different, perhaps better solution, but the end goal would be to never have to listen to a "clean" version again when the original is available. Previous submissions and discussionsMany ideas have been submitted before, they are however all closed, marked as duplicate, marked as "unclear" or found to have not enough votes.This new submission is an attempt to combine all previous efforts and hopefully get some traction.While not all of the options discussed below are exactly the same, they are all about this topic and they all suggest some way of playing the original over the clean edit.If you see all the previous topics in the table below (there are probably others that I might have missed), it is clear that this is a frequently brought up topic in the community.Hopefully listing them here helps people find this feature request. title: [Discover] New Releases Section for Followed Artists INSTEAD of Release Radar Playlist
author: d-roam
body: This is a follow-up to this idea: New Releases Section for Followed Artists by @MattSuda. While the original idea currently has over 1,300 votes, Spotify's answer was that the Release Radar playlist meets the need presented. I don't think this is true, and I have doubts that the +1,000 people who voted do, either. So this new idea is an attempt to gauge the level of support for a true New Releases from Followed Artists section in spite of the existence of the new Release Radar playlist. We want a feed that:Shows new releases ONLY from the artists we follow, and shows ALL new releases from the artists we followShows releases neatly in chronological order, with clear headings showing the full release date (day, month, and year)Neatly presents new releases in the form they were released (i.e., EP's and Albums are shown as such rather than as a list of all songs within them -- or make this a toggle option)Goes back in time as far as possible (preferably all time, to show all releases from our Followed Artists in chronological order)Clearly indicates which releases are new to us since our last visitHas a number badge on the button for the section that tells us if there are new releases since our last visit, and how manyNot crucial but nice to have: Can be filtered by time frame, artist, release type (album, EP, single), country, genre, etc.

We'll continue passing your feedback along to the right teams too.Thanks

title: [Playlists] Expand "Discovered On" User-Generated Playlists on Artist Profiles to Show On Mobile
author: outtallectuals
body: BackgroundEarlier this year with Spotify's UI change, user-generated playlists (UGP) were removed from artist profiles, before subsequently returning on desktop (with some expansion to now show 50 playlists when pressing 'See All'). Despite the initial scare, it was nice to see that Discovered On made *some* come-back, but it needs more. It's currently unfair that Spotify only shows its own playlists on Mobile, completely removing visibility on UGP.In fact, with Spotify's recent streamlining of Web/Mobile/Desktop App UIs to all look and function similarly, this new addition shouldn't be difficult at all. If anything, I imagine Spotify is actively omitting Discovered On from artist profiles on mobile now (You can see this in the A/B difference attached, between the Mobile & Narrow Desktop App window view, which are practically the same, except the omission of Discovered On).I'm requesting for Discovered On to show on Mobile as it does on Desktop, so that:- Listeners can tap into the huge world of user-curated playlists to find similar artists. - Independent curators (labels, bloggers, influencers, etc.) can still have visibility for their playlists, and not drown in an overly monopolized Spotify environment.- Artists can also obviously enjoy getting more discovery and visibility through a largely available yet untapped resource, especially artists who DEPEND on third party curators, i.e. those not picked up by Spotify algorithms and editorials which are arguably most artists on the platform.How To Achieve This:It's very simple. Below the Featuring, Fans Also Like, Appears On & Artist Playlists widget/tabs, just show Discovered On tab as is shown on Desktop. Simple.Thank you!

title: [Android] Support USB Audio directly - bypassing the Android Driver
author: ZorkII
body: USB DAC/amps are less impressive on Android Spotify because the standard Android driver is up-sampling. The Dragonfly Red runs at 44.1kHz with Spotify on my PC but on Android it up-samples to 96kHz causing glitching. Other DACs have similar issues. The proposal is for Spotify to access USB DACs directly, bypassing the Android driver. Audiophile music players already take this approach, e.g. USB Audio Player PRO (UAPP) and Neutron. Tidal works with UAPP. This idea is a version of "Support USB Audio through the USB Audio Player PRO driver" without the 3rd party partnership. It was written in response to @meahtenoha's review. Both ideas originate from the USB audio out OTG support thread. External USB headphone DAC/amps for Android phones are becoming a thing. What Hi-Fi has a Best DACs page that mainly lists portable audiophile kit. I would prefer to carry a phone and a DAC rather than a phone and a portable music player because it is more fun to have access to the whole Spotify catalogue.

title: [Android Automotive][Radio] Offline Mode
author: Steini984
body: Isn't it annoying when you are driving around in your new car, playing music from Spotify and it suddenly just stops? You are might driving over mountain roads with no internet connection and no radio connection and you are forced to listen to the awkward silence, knowing that you will not get internet connection in at least an hour. My question is then why doesn't Spotify in Android Automotive (in cars like Polestar 2) have an offline function, just like on the android and iOS phones? I would suggest an idea of implementing offline mode to be able to download music playlists so you don't need to listen to the awkward silence when you have no internet connection to listen to your music. I hope I'm not the only one thinking about this, and I hope there can be a solution for the problem.

title: [Mobile][Playlists] "+/-" buttons on Enhanced playlist need to be on the Now Playing screen
author: RoonZ
body: In an enhanced playlists, the now playing bar NEEDS the "+/-" feature to add/subtract songs from that position in the enhanced playlist. This would improve the suggestion algorithm and create pockets of inspired micro-radios within a playlist around the suggested song around the song it was similar to. At the moment, if you like a song in the enhanced playlist you are FORCED to scroll through the entire playlist until you find the track just to press the "+/-" button. Pressing the "add to playlist" option adds the song to the last position in the playlist and would ruin the flow of the playlist and the suggestion algorithm. Fix this, you're effectively ruining the usability of the enhanced feature without this.

title: [iOS][Connect] Safety issue: restore last screen when starting up
author: JakeTorim
body: Typical scenario when I get in my car and drive off: T+15 seconds: Pull out of parking space T+20 seconds: Enter traffic T+35 seconds: Spotify app connects to iPhone via CarPlay T+40 seconds: Music starts playing. I want to know what's playing, but I can't tell because Spotify always reverts to the information-free "Good morning" screen that nobody but your own marketing department asked for T+45 seconds: I think to myself, "Self, you really shouldn't grope around trying to get back to the player screen while driving. It's not safe." T+55 seconds: "Aw, I'll bet I can get away it, just this once." T+60 seconds: I grope around trying to hit the amazingly-tiny button at upper right to return to the player screen T+65 seconds: Nope, I'm still not quite able to hit that button. Must be the coffee. T+70 seconds: Somebody honks at me. I ignore them, because I'm now psychologically committed to pressing that darned button. Poke, poke, poke some more T+75 seconds: Ah, there it is. Back to the player screen, with album art, song title, and transport controls finally accessible, JUST THE WAY I LEFT THEM WHEN I PARKED THE CAR Seriously. Please give some thought to human factors and traffic safety when making terrible usability decisions like this one. Restore the user interface to the state it was last in when the driver shut the car off... like an 8-track player from 1975 would do.

title: [Playlists] A blend playlist that lets you invite more than 10 people
author: Gemini_Breaker
body: What if you want the most chaotic music playlist, what if you want the most diverse playlist, and what if you want such a variety that Spotify can't match it's randomness. I just tried to create a blended playlist with everyone I know as a social experiment/ a genuine look at people's music mashing together into something chaotic. My biggest beef is that the blended playlist doesn't give you any indication that 10 people is its max until you invite an 11th person. Listen, I know I am the only one that is overly passionate about this but think of the possibilities! You could group a whole class together on one playlist to branch yourself out of your music slump, or a whole family so that people can see what their family members are listening to. I think that this is a created space that could really be explored more, Thank you and I hope you can kind of see how great this would be.

title: [All Platforms][Playlists] Prevent the enhance function from adding duplicates

title: [Mobile][Your Library] Have a Follow hierarchy based on your top 2-3 favourite artists
author: stevenaedwards1
body: I've just come across a new artist (thanks Spotify). I've clicked Follow so the artist is added to my list of liked artists but then i had a thought, how cool would it be if you could have a hierarchy of artists that you follow. For example, i could have 2-3 absolute favourite artists which should stand out from the list; this should also have an affect on the individual song likes i've done as well as album listings. OK i could also put these absolute fave artists into a playlist but that then becomes static; this would allow future content added by these TOP artists to stand out. Finally and this is more important, you would have another metric to add to your repertoire - labels/artists would see how many users TOP list they make. Comprende? Good idea?

title: [Mobile][Playlists] Dont Play this Artist factors into Suggestions
author: Kmg8043
body: I spend 98% of my time these days blocking artists I have no interest in. Literally 98% of what you suggest in Release Radar or Discovery Weekly or Daily Mix. This is not what an end user should have to experience in such a high percentage. The formula should be improved so that artists that are "similar" to the ones I am blocking, also do not get suggested. In example, if I am blocking 100% of foreign artists or a certain genre....the formula should be smart enough to pick up on that. After all, it is data, and should be easily mineable. You probably walk past someone every day that has the basic skillset to analyze data sets. SPOTIFY EMPLOYEE....DO NOT TELL ME this idea is already out there. Last time you linked this to an idea where someone suggested adding a new button like Not Interested on Youtube. I AM NOT ASKING for a new button....this already exists....it is a feature you have that hides artists. I am simply asking you to give this merit in your formulas for suggestions on playlists like Discovery Weekly, Daily Mix, Release Radar. IF YOU ALLOW ME TO BLOCK ARTISTS....you should be smart enough to not suggest similar artists. Easy....anyone with basic mining skills can tell you how to do this

title: [Playlists] Additive & Subtractive Playlists
author: neilforreal
body: Additive & Subtractive Playlists are an idea I had the other day. I was listening to my February playlist and realized that I like the songs I have on there, but if I want to play that playlist at night, there are some songs I'd like to leave out (I love the riff of Nefi + Girly, but it's not something I'd fall asleep to). Hence the idea of additive playlists and subtractive playlists. This will consist of one pair of two playlists. One will have the full array of songs -- the additive -- and one will have that array minus the ones you take out -- the subtractive. On the diagram below, 1 is the additive playlist and 2 is the subtractive (For my example, you could think of 1 as February and 2 as February Night). When I add a playlist to February, it goes into February Night as well. And when I add a song to February Night, it also goes into February (blue arrows). But when I remove a song from February, I don't want it anywhere; it's removed from both. If I remove a song from February Night, it's only removed from the one (red arrows). In execution, I could see the user right-clicking a playlist and selecting create subtractive playlist, producing a pair of playlists, additive and subtractive.

title: [Desktop] Support Notifications on Mac
author: reephamblues
body: I would appreciate it if Spotify on macOS could support desktop notifications (current song etc.) via Apple's Notification Center. This is basic functionality that's provided by almost every other Mac app I can think of. Spotify has offered it in the past, and indeed there's still a zombie preference setting ("Show dekstop notifications when the song changes"). I'm irritated at not having something as simple as notifications, and I feel insulted by a preference setting that doesn't work. I'm proposing this here because it seems to have been last raised as an Idea in 2012 and set to Not Right Now status in 2019. That was a long time ago. This Idea is therefore a follow-up to this more recent discussion on the subject. Mod MafeG invited us to raise the issue on the Idea Exchange, so that's what I've done.

The reason this is needed is because often I listen to music while working, then I'll go have lunch or do an errand and want to listen to a podcast or audiobook. title: [Mobile][Browse] Easter-Egg Games in Canvas
author: AmaniHiphop
body: Netflix has videogames on their platform. I was thinking, what if we had that on here? But not like a whole menu of videogames to play. That would take the focus away from the music. What I'm suggesting is alongside canvas's, give artists the opportunity to submit simple interactions or games that the listener can participate in in order to connect with the music and art more and enrich their experience. It allows the artist to immerse the listener even further into their song and fully bring out their vision. The games don't have to be like an entire mobile game or even a game at all. It could be a simple slide/button click to unlock/open up a second canvas or something like the Yeezy Gap Game: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-euzeXlHJVM (this is more of what I envision, but even more simpler, like pixelated or just easier to make). What do you guys think? I think this can benefit artist most of all because if a listener was able to physically interact with an song, they would be more likely to take interest in the artist and become a fan possibly and connect more with the artist/song.

title: [Desktop][Mobile][Discover] Radio based on rhythm\beat\instruments of current song
author: johnnyannis
body: Let's say there is a song that I love (say Stairway to Heaven as an example). If I want to start a radio playlist from that song, I get a station based on that song in general. What is however, there is a particular part of that song that I enjoy (let's say The Bridge). There should be a drill down option when creating a radio playlist that allows me to select the particular part of that song that I want to use for the radio suggestions. Some examples could include General (for the whole song), RPM, Key, Guitar, Drums, The Bridge, The Chorus, The Lyrical Content, The Harmony, The Melody, The Time Signature or even the ability to select a section of the song that you want to use for the suggestions. In this day and age of AI, development and innovation, this should be very easy to do. Please consider kudos and voting for this.

title: [iOS][Other] Spotify Interface Enhancement
author: VinayPrathapan
body: On the current Spotify interface (on the iOS), the Now Playing face template allows one to swipe up anywhere on the screen to scroll up to the live lyrics area. While this is nice, the gesture as implemented interferes with the playback position / seek interface for the song currently playing and it results in a jerky experience which is quite annoying. A simple re-designation of the region on the Now Playing screen which blocks out vertical touch responses on the horizontally-advancing playback position / seek interface will result in a significantly enhanced user experience that Spotify ought to exploit.

title: [Desktop][Other] Virtual Assistant
author: That_Kael
body: Often when I am listening to Spotify on my computer I have it minimized. I will be writing down some notes for work, then a song I haven't heard before comes on and I want to know its name without losing my flow. Or I will be playing a video game, then I want to swap what playlist I am listening to.The most convenient option, I feel, would be to add a voice-activated virtual assistant. Being sound based would make it on-theme for Spotify and would increase the accessibility for people with impaired vision. This is important as desktop Spotify has a very low contrast GUI, with no high contrast setting options.Other voice-activated virtual assistants (Bixby, Cortana, etc.). Can't be used to control Spotify and, if they can, will have decreased functionality.In conclusion, I believe that having voice-control in Spotify will not only increase usability, it will also increase accessibility for visually impaired.

title: [Playlists] Shuffle+ A new shuffling method
author: Haisom
body: Hello everyone! Ever wondered why everyone is still stuck on same old Shuffle? Whether is shuffling non heard songs properly or is just completely Random, it's still always the same. How about improving this tech a little bit? This idea was already posted once through this link: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Closed-Ideas/Music-Supreme-Shuffle-among-artists-albums-etc/idc-p/4...However, it didn't get enough kudos per year, but I'm ready to try again and be more engaging with the community that share same expectations from Spotify. Shuffle+ is all about listening all your favorite songs in the most diverse order you never thought would be possible. "How?" you may ask. Simple. Instead of being a random shuffle, or true shuffle, Shuffle+ would works as a filter check where you can choose what to Shuffle or not. Example 1: Imagine my standard Favorite playlist from Spotify is already ordered by Album. So every time you play it, it will always play the same songs in the very same order. From album to album, alphabetically. However, I'm feeling like listening to them on a different order, but still want to enjoy whole albums or artists separately instead of shuffling through musical genres. So, you would do this: [ ] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [ ] Genre Then hit play! What would this do? Spotify would only Shuffle+ among albums until that artist's albums in your favorite playlist are over, then, it would play tracks in order from the next artist's albums with similar genre, because only album was checked . For this to work they would need to add a new Column on library just for Genres. If not, we would only be able to shuffle among artist, album and tracks, though, with random genres. Example 2: [x] Artist [ ] Album [x] Track [ ] Genre This would make Spotify play a artist's whole tracks in shuffle mode, independent of albums, meaning albums order would be random, but all his songs would be played, no matter what. Then, would go to the next Artist and repeat it to that artist, and so on. Example 3: [ ] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [x] Genre This one would make Spotify Shuffle among Albums and Genres, don't minding Artist or Track order. Once one Album from one Genre finished, it would play the next Album in the next Genre. If Genre is not implemented by Spotify, then it would be like example 1. Example 4: [x] Artist [x] Album [x] Track [x] Genre This would work just like usual Shuffle. Example 5: [x] Artist [x] Album [ ] Track [ ] Genre This would play one artist album in proper tracks order, then Shuffle to another artist's album and repeat. REMINDER: Always remember that whenever Shuffle+ is active, only what is selected will shuffle. Unselected items should play in proper order. Now... How would that look like? Just like the 'Loop' option alternates among 'Loop All', 'Loop One', and 'Loop Off', the 'Shuffle' button could alternate the same among 'Shuffle', 'Shuffle+', and 'Shuffle Off'.The concept of the "check boxes" to select what would be included in shuffle could be done by touch/holding 'Shuffle' on media player button to open up the 'Shuffle+' menu, where the main/first option would be 'On/Off', then the second would have the "tags/checkboxes" to pick what you want to shuffle. Doing so would save that as you preset for Shuffle+, always using it whenever you're cycling among Shuffle option. This means if the user wants to change how his Shuffle+ shuffles through content, he would have to open that menu. Hope you all get the idea. If you don't, please say in the comments and I will try to make it clearer. PS: Not intended for Liked playlist only or Freemium users. Since this is a really complex shuffle method, would only apply to Premium and would apply to all available platforms if possible. Please! Comment bellow what are your thoughts, what could be improved, if you liked it or not. I will update the idea as we get more opinions about it so we can improve it together. HELP SHARING THE WORD! =D -----CHANGELOG----- *Update 08/23/2021 - Fixed example 3 as I got confused with the explanation. Before even though Genre was checked, it was not being shuffled in the example as it should be with anything that is checked on Shuffle+ filter - Added examples 4 and 5 - Fixed a few sintax errors *Update 07/18/2021 -Added a little capped observation that maybe wasn't so clear -Added changelog section to the bottom with all updates/edits so far *Update 06/14/2021 -Added 1 extra example with album and genre- -Added how it it would look and deepened on simplified toggle on/off- -Mixed both PSs together-

We really appreciate it ðŸ™‚More information about how the Spotify Idea Exchange works can be found here.

title: [All Platforms] Shuffle algorithm that favours "unpopular" songs
author: fraktalisman
body: As a paying Spotify premium customer, I need a shuffle algorithm different from the current, non-random shuffle that seems to favor "popular" songs, as has been pointed out by other customers who experimented with what is actually happening (see links to other posts below).Currently there are only two possible ways to listen to music in playlists, either in the listed order, or shuffled by an algorithm that makes listeners miss out on about 20% to 30% of the songs in the list, favoring the ones that we already listened to hundreds or thousands of times.I want to be able to choose another algorithm that does exactly the opposite: play songs in a pseudo-random order but leaving out the ones that already have been played frequently, and instead focusing on songs seldom listened to, in order to make me rediscover new songs and inspirations! This is even more important when listening to playlists made by other people, to help me discover new music.The new algorithm could be called something like "serendipity shuffle" or "discover mode". This could be an option to activate in the user's settings, so the existing popularity shuffle would stay the default option.In case a serendipity shuffle is too hard for you to implement, a simple randomized shuffle function would also be much better than the current one. This has already been pointed out in other posts in this forum.See other posts in this community:https://community.spotify.com/t5/Ongoing-Issues/Shuffle-Is-Only-Going-Through-A-Handful-Of-Songs/idc...https://community.spotify.com/t5/Ongoing-Issues/Please-stop-marking-shuffle-complaints-as-quot-not-a...

title: [Daily Mix] Customization: Create / Remove / Add / Merge Mixes
author: user-removed
body: Daily Mixes is one of the best additions to Spotify yet, but as all new features it has room for a lot of improvement, especially when it comes to customizing your mixes. Right now mixes are enterily dependent on algorithms, however I think users should have a degree of personal input on how mixes are built. For example, it would be great if users could select a couple of songs and then have Spotify create a mix based on those songs. It would also be great if users could remove a mix and replace it with another, or merge different mixes into one. For example, Spotify created two different EDM mixes for me, one based on house music, and another based on tech house tracks. I find that a little redundant and I would like to merge both mixes into one. There's also another mix which is a weird combination of ambient, IDM, downtempo and indie rock tracks (?). I would like to split that mix in two, one for indie rock and another for IDM, downtempo and ambient music. And then there's a pop/R&B mix which I'd like to replace entirely with a jazz music mix, since I don't listen to that much mainstream pop and R&B music in the first place. Expanding the number of daily mixes to 8 would be great as well, since 6 mixes doesn't quite cover the variety of music I tend to listen to. Finally, being able to add back to mixes songs or artists that you banned on accident is a must.
status_message: Updated on 2019-06-25Hey folks,Â  Â  Thanks for adding your vote to this idea.Â  Â  You can create your own generated mixes by selecting Radio on any track, album or song you like - which will generate a playlist of similar songs. As mentioned in the idea, you could make a playlist of a couple of songs and then select 'Radio' by clicking the three dots to make your own funky mix.Â  Â  We have no further information on removing unwanted Daily Mixes, but we'll keep this idea open and keep you posted of any news here.Â  Â  Thanks!

author: kay0002
body: Share this with everyone you know and ask them to vote! Spotify Integration with BMW Idrive 6 has always been sporadic and not all advertised features work. The latest Spotify versions 8.5.68.904 and 8.5.6.9.934 have bugs and the App does not appear in IDrive at all. The pervious version of Spotify was somewhat unreliable as I had to occasionally repair my phone with the car. I can no longer see the Spotify App in my BMW media list. I can only listen to spotify from the bmw bluetooth audio option. I've tried pairing an iPhone and the app appears on iDrive. For my android issue I deleted the App data and cache of both Bmw ConnectedDrive and Spotify app. I also unpaird the bluetooth connection between my smartphone car. Lastly, I uninstalled both Spotify and the BMW Apps. Nothing works. Additionally, it would be great if my Playlist order in my car matched the order on the phone. For example, although my phone app is sorted alphabetically, my car would only show playlists in the order of what was most recently created. Who else thinks Spotify needs to get it together and provide a quality app that integrates with iDrive? Fix the Spotify Bug!

title: [iOS] Do NOT automatically hide the Timer in Now Playing
author: vmc923
body: A recent upgrade has resulted in the song timer blacking out in the Spotify App after a few seconds on a song -- I am a cycling instructor, and I need to see where I am in a track without having to reach down an hit the screen for it to show up again (I accidently jumped to the following track in the middle of a workout the other day trying to figure out where we were in the song). So yes, you can make it re-appear, but when you are leading a class with 50 people in it, and still riding, it is a huge pain to have to pick up your phone multiple times in a song, and very carefully tap the screen (without swiping) to see what minute mark you are at. Having the slider is not sufficient as we time our classes and songs with planned races and pickups (so, for example, I need to be able to know that there is a pickup at 1:22-157, and that there are 7 seconds before it happens, or 32 seconds until the end of the song, etc. etc.). Removing the timer saves NO space on the screen, and is more of nuscance than anything else. Please bring back the song timer, or at least give people the option to say "Yes hide the timer after a few seconds", or, "No, leave the timer there". There are thousands of fitness professionals in the same position -- along with my entire studio who use spotify, and we are all irritated with this new feature. Please, please, PLEASE change it back. This has been a huge headache since last week's update.
status_message: Updated: 2015-07-29 Hey folks, we're marking this as a 'Good idea'. Continue to leave your feedback here and we'll keep bringing it back to the teams at Spotify, thanks!

title: [Radio] AM/FM Radio Streaming
author: user-removed
body: A suggestion like this has already been marked inactive, but I do believe that Spotify can be made a more complete service by incorporating AM and FM radio channel streaming. If it would be possible to add stations in to the radio feature, perhaps separating stations into two categories, live radio and Spotify radio, then Spotify would truly become the chosen one, giving users access to virtually every legal music listening service on the market. Listeners could use the feature for new popular music, news, and talk entertainment. Similar to the way the feature currently works, listeners could save their favorite stations, and browse through lists organized by genre, location, or amplitude/frequency. Feedback from people familiar with the way that radio stations would react to third-party streaming would be particularly appreciated to solve the business end of this proposal. Let's get this second attempt at implementing a good feature a shot at getting off the ground!

title: [Android][Other] Modernize app icon to support Android 13 Material You device theming
author: Andrewcpu
body: Android 13 has introduced the required API to theme app icons based on user color themes. The Spotify app is a perfect candidate for this style of theming given the fact it's a simple icon that can be colored and themed independently from the actual shape of the icon. The implantation of the themed icon is relatively simple for a developer and would only require at MOST 3 hours of work for infinite benefit to users. The actual change in reality is setting a simple XML flag and pointing to the monochrome logo. There's a list of apps which are adding support for this feature here: https://9to5google.com/2022/08/27/android-13-themed-icons/ It's a good plan to add it soon because currently users consider the Spotify app icon because it's an eye sore compared to other themed app icons. The updated Material You logo is now present in the Alpha + Beta channels. However, I would say either the monochrome icon needs to be shrunk slightly, OR Spotify should drop the solid circle from the monochrome logo, and leave the 3 lines as solid instead of the 3 lines being a cut out.

title: [All Platforms] Offer Subscription Option for Those Not Going Online Every 30 Days
author: rmurgaz
body: This issue has been already posted several times, but no solution up to now.Some people have the problem of not having an Internet connection for months. Or at least, not good enough.This can happen to military, fishermen or humanitarian aid workers. Spotify disables the downloaded music in case the App in the device does not go "online" at least once every 30 days, no matter if you pay the subscription or not.Therefore, one can be paying the Premium subscription to Spotify, but not having the downloaded songs available due to a lack of Internet connection (it occurs even when there is Internet connection, but not "good enough" for Spotify).So, my request to Spotify is to find a different way to have the downloaded songs available even if the App cannot go online.Thank you.

title: [Search] Search by BPM (Beats per Minute)
author: PhilP
body: Hi All,As someone who loves punishing my body by going for long runs, a good playlist to keep me company is essential! Picking out and discovering which 'choons' are going to speed me up and push me further can be tricky.One trick used by many runners is to search out and find songs which all have a similar number of beats per minute so they can place them in order and then use the beat of the song to run to. As such, it would be awesome to be able to search Spotify for songs which have specific ranges of BPM and then pick the cool [subjective] ones for inclusion in your playlists. Cheers!
status_message: Updated on 2018-08-23Hi everyone! Â  Thanks for bringing us your feedback in the Spotify Idea Exchange. title: [Your Music] Add LOCAL FILES to Your Music
author: HjalteRMC
body: First of, I'm a huge fan of the new layout. But as the title says I'd like to add my own beloved local files to the "Your Music". I don't see why this shouldn't be a possibilty. This way I don't need to have one master playlist, I can just have all the music I like under "Your Music -> Songs". Also, as suggested earlier, changing the font size could be usable to many people.
status_message: Updated on 2022-07-14Hey everyone,Thanks for bringing us your feedback in the Spotify Idea Exchange. We're marking this as a 'Good Idea'.Please know your feedback is reaching the internal teams at Spotify, and they're aware of the votes around this idea. We'll continue to check out the comments here, too.In the meantime there's a workaround we can suggest to ultimately get Local Files added to your Liked Songs on a mobile device: First, add your personal music collection using the recently updated Local Files feature (Android/Desktop how to,Â iOS how to) where they'll appear in Local Files.Â You can then add them to your playlists. Just right click > add to playlist. Â  Once your track is discovered on your mobile app, Once your track is discovered on your mobile app, you'll be able to tap the heart icon to add it to your Liked Songs as you would any other track. Keep in mind, that it is currently not possible to add Local Files to Liked Songs on the desktop app. We know it's not ideal, but hope that it will be useful for some of you.If there are any new updates, rest assured we'll let you know, Cheers!

title: [Desktop] More options for full screen mode
author: jordonian
body: For some of the spotify made playlist, there are different color gradients while in full screen mode. Apart from the normal grey gradient. If there was a way to have custom preferences for full screen mode, that would make it much more appealing, and be a great thing to have on in the background during a party. Some of the options could be, One color: pick a color, and the background is that gradientCycling colors: the gradients will cycle through all the available colorsPicture / gif upload: someone could upload a specific .jpeg or .gif and it will be behind the album cover, title, artist.Different stylized options for the album cover: This one might be more complex, but it could have the album off to a side, then the other side have the artist / title. The extra space could also be filled with some of the gifs from the mobile app on spotify that artist can upload.I would very much enjoy more options, to have more visual interest at my parties.

title: 'Add all songs to playlist'
author: abhedgepath
body: Allow all songs in an existing playlist to be added to a new created playlist. It would be good to have the option to 'Add all songs to playlist' from an existing created playlist to a new created playlist.For example: I have a 'notable songs' playlist for each year. I've been doing this since 2016. If I wanted to have all my favorite songs from the last 5 years in one playlist, it would be really easy to create a 'notable 2016-current' playlist by adding all the existing songs from each year's playlist together. The only option right now is to add each individual song from each year's playlist using the 'Add to playlist' option. That's the difference of 6 clicks and about 600 clicks. Would be helpful. Thanks!

title: [Your Library] Edit track metadata
author: theknine2
body: Apple Music has this neat feature that allows users to edit track metadata for all tracks added to the user's library. This is most useful for putting custom artwork for albums or removing (Deluxe) or (Remastered) tags on albums, and removing parentheses in track titles. This feature is also useful for scrobbling with Last.fm, a feature that is not built into Apple Music. Custom artwork for albums is a popular feature on Apple as fans can use their fan-made artwork in screenshots. Being able to edit track and album metadata on Spotify would be great for people like me who love to micro-manage their music library.

title: [Android] Swipe to Queue on SEARCH
author: Gannondank
body: Hello! I advocated for the "swipe to queue" feature on Android, and I want to thank the developers for partially implementing that. My request is for songs to be swipeable on the search page. Frankly, that's what most of us were expecting when we requested the feature. Again, I want to stress how this feature improves both the safety and quality of life of each listener by streamlining the time spent constructing one's feed. Whether when navigating or in public, situational awareness is paramount. In a time when many of us could stand to deflate our phone usage, simple quality-of-life features such as this make surprising improvements to user happiness and to the connection with their music. Thank you for considering! At its current stage, the swipe feature remains incomplete at best for many people. My thanks again to the dev team!

title: [Oculus][Other] Spotify for Oculus Rift & Quest VR Platform
author: DJ-MastaJ
body: It would be really cool to have two of my favourite things for entertainment join forces....... My Oculus Quest (or Rift) and Spotify. It would give users the very unique ability to see Spotify in such a different way and have access to their library and playlists in a whole new amazing way. That would make it enjoyable to manage, listen to and curate playlists. Not only that, it would then give users the ability to link Spotify to certain apps and games within Oculus allowing them to stream Spotify music while playing games or apps in VR. With a surround sound experience to accompany amazing visual content. Virtual Reality Oculus is amazing and it's made by Facebook, I could only imagine what could be possible if Spotify was to integrate also.... There is also an app called Tribe which is an amazing DJing VR app, there is even potential to pay a special membership for using Spotify for Oculus and being able to use the songs on the virtual decks only while using VR as to not infringe copyrights etc etc. I think there is so much potential in this especially in these down dark times of Coronavirus where we are all stuck at home in lockdowns etc. And are turning to VR or remote platform to work, live play and entertain ourselves and our families while at home. While keeping each other and our world as safe as we can with Social distancing. Spotify for Oculus VR........ I reckon it's a winner, please bring it on!

title: [Android] Set Spotify as Default Player
author: francocm
body: Android applications seem to support some form of integration with the Android OS to identify as a music player. Going to: Settings > Apps > *Gear Icon* > *Default Section* > Music app: I'm able to select which application on my phone should be the default app for music, and the phone presents me with a list of choices:Google Play MusicMX Player ProES File Explorer ProIPTV Pro.As you can see, Spotify is not on the list. If those apps can make it to the list, so can Spotify. Would be really great to see official integration with Android in this regard, especially because such integration helps a lot when connecting the phone with the car! Screenshot attached. Phone: OnePlus 5OS: Oxygen OS 4.5.2 / Android 7.1.1OS Build: ONEPLUS A5000_23_170624 Thanks (P.S. Originally posted in the Android section, but was recommended to post it here)

title: [Community][Connect] JAMAICAN CHARTS
author: TheJAU876
body: Despite having our own unique music industry with artists from across the island being huge overseas, Jamaica was deprived of this streaming platform for several years. it wasn't until February of 2021 that we finally got access to Spotify alongside other Caribbean/African nations. Now that we have Spotify (which is great for the visibility of Jamaicans and our artists world-wide), we now feel that we need some charts to truly showcase the popularity of artists and songs within our nation. This includes a Hot Hits chart, Viral 50, Top Songs Weekly and a Daily Top 50. Jamaican artists deserve to see how popular they are within their own nation and Jamaican fans deserve to see how their favorite international musicians fare in their own island. We hope that our idea finds the Spotify team well. The Jamaican ARMY Union

title: [Subscription][Security] Re-enter Payment Details to Upgrade to Family
author: honda234
body: Once hackers get access to my Spotify account, they will change my regular Premium subscription to Premium For Family and add strangers to my plan. I will be charged $5 extra each month! Spotify does NOT require to enter my credit card number to change the subscription type, which leaves the risk to users. It means hackers NOT ONLY have stolen Spotify accounts, but also have stolen stored payment method to pay for family plans. But in France and the UK, Spotify requires to enter the credit card number to change the subscription type to a Family plan. (free Google home mini was the reason why Spotify start asking for re-enter credit card info, but the offer has ended, Spotify no longer ask for re-enter card info...) Idea: Please ask users to re-enter card number when changing regular Premium to a Family plan. Just like what Spotify did in US/UK/FR markets when free Google Home minis were giving to family owners for free. So hacked users won't be charged unauthorized money when hackers upgrading their plans to the family plan using stored payment method.

title: [Desktop] Support WASAPI Output
author: seanpatrick76
body: Hey there, I've just got the trial subscription to Spotify and am enjoying it thus far, HOWEVER there's a pretty major downside to its playback capabilities when compared to other programs - in that it doesn't have either a WASAPI output. You can force "all channel stereo" through a receiver, but that doesn't sound quite as good. XBMC does this excellently, and has a rudimentary spotify app - however it's not near as user-friendly or functional as the actual spotify app. It just sounds WAY WAY better. When deciding whether to continue my subscription after the trial period in a few months time this will definitely be one of the deciding factors. Thanks for bringing Spotify to Canada though! TL;DR - Add Wasapi support.

body: I am Emanuele and I am 16 years old. I thought about an interesting idea that I would add to your platform. title: [Chromecast] Stream highest possible Quality to Chromecast
author: hevaKmaI
body: After casting Spotify from my iPhone or Android phone onto my new Chromecast audio device(s) I was disappointed to discover that I could not set the device to extreme quality, even though I am a premium member. It would be good to allow a default extreme quality setting on all devices used on my account or to allow setting the quality in the iOS/Android app. Support says Spotify transcodes from their native Vorbis codec to 256kbps AAC, which further reduces audio quality, especially since Chromecast Audio seems to natively support Vorbis. Spotify should strive to make their service use the best possible audio quality on any platform, and that doesn't seem to be the case right now with Chromecast.

body: As of 1/8/2018 the spotify widget is currently on a 1x4 size. Many newer phones have the ability to hold more icon columns (more than 4) therefore the spotify player looks poorly made and ill fitting. title: Redistribute Spotify on Linux Distributions
author: NicoHood
body: Dear Spotify Team,my name is NicoHood and I am an official ArchLinux Trusted User. This means I maintain some packages in the official [community] repository [1]. I am also able to move packages from the ArchLinux User Repository (AUR)[2] into [community] if the packages are popular enough (>10 votes). As you can imagine spotify is really popular on ArchLinux with more than 1100 votes on AUR[3]. Me and the community would love to have spotify in our official repositories to provide our users a simpler channel of installing Spotify on ArchLinux. The problem we face is that the Terms of Use forbid us to redistribute Spotify. We'd require an official statement that ArchLinux is allowed to package Spotify in its repositories. I've already contacted Brendan Marsh (Product Owner, Desktop) about this topic via email without any further response. It would be nice if you can give the linux community a better channel for installing Spotify on non-debian systems. Furthermore we then can cooperate and optimize spotify for ArchLinux (e.g. using more shared libraries, providing gpg signed tarballs and https downloads etc). Me and the community hope to get some positive feedback. Thanks for taking the time. Please upvote this post if you also with to natively install Spotify on ArchLinux and other Linux Systems. [1]: https://www.archlinux.org/packages/?maintainer=NicoHood[2]: https://aur.archlinux.org/[3]: https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/spotify/ Edit 28.08.2019: This request has been marked as idea by the spotify staff. Please upvote it here: https://community.spotify.com/t5/Live-Ideas/Linux-Add-Spotify-to-the-official-Linux-repositories/idi...
